\hebeng{אֱמֶת צְדָקָה תְּרוֹמֵם גּוֹי הַשִּׁלּוּהִים. וְחֶסֶד לְאֻמִּים חַטָּאת עַם הַתּוֹהִים. אֲשֶׁר לָעֵץ וְלָאֶבֶן מַאֲלִיהִים. וַיהֹוָה אֱלֹהִים אֱמֶת:\par }{Truth and justice shall uplift the nation that has been weakened, but the kindness of nations is sinful, the nations that regret {[their good deeds]}, that declare wood and stone to be gods. And only Adonoy, God is true.}
\hebeng{אֱמֶת קְנֵה וְאַל תִּמְכֹּר, לְשָׁרְתוֹ וּלְעָבְדוֹ. לְרוֹמֵם שֵׁם־יְהֹוָה כִּי־נִשְׂגָּב שְׁמוֹ לְבַדּוֹ. לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ לְכָל־חַי רָצוֹן פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת־יָדוֹ. כִּי גָבַר עָלֵינוּ חַסְדּוֹ וֶאֱמֶת:\par }{Buy truthfulness \textit{Based on Avos Chap. I, Mishnah 6.} and do not sell it. \textit{Teach others without pay.} {[Do this]} in order to serve and worship to uplift the Name of Adonoy for His Name alone is exalted, for He satiates every living thing according to his wants. {[He does this]} with an open hand. He gives abundantly to us of His kindness and trustworthiness.}
\hebeng{אֱמֶת רָאֹה תִרְאֶה בָּעֳנִי יִשְׂרָאֵל. מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ תְּהוֹם רַבָּה וְצִדְקָתְךָ כְּהַרְרֵי־אֵל. וְקַבֵּל תְּפִלַּת־עַם אֲשֶׁר לְךָ שׁוֹאֵל. בְּיָדְךָ אַפְקִיד רוּחִי פָּדִיתָ אוֹתִי יְהֹוָה אֵל־אֱמֶת:\par }{Truly see the neediness of Israel for Your judgment is deep as the abyss and Your justice as the highest mountains. Accept the prayer of the nation that turns to You with its requests: “In your hands do I place my soul for You {[always]} redeem me, {[You]}, Adonoy the trusthworthy God.”}
\hebeng{אֱמֶת שׁוֹפֵט דַּלִּים וְכִסְאוֹ יִכּוֹן לְדוֹר־דּוֹרִים. מֶלֶךְ בְּמִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִיד אֶרֶץ וַאֲוִירִים. יַחֲשֹׁב מַעֲשָׂיו אֵל אַדִּירִים. אַחֲרֵי הַדְּבָרִים וְהָאֱמֶת:\par }{{[You]}, Who truthfully judges the poor and Whose Throne is established for all the generations; {[You]}, the King Who establishes the world with justice as well as the heavens, shall consider the deeds {[of man]} {[You]}, the mighty God according to the truth of things.}
\hebeng{אֱמֶת תִּתֵּן לְיַעֲקֹב וְחֶסֶד לְאַב הֲמוֹנִי. כִּי מֵאַהֲבָתְךָ קְרָאתַנִי בְּכוֹרִי וּבְנִי. הַלְבֵּן חֲטָּאֵינוּ הָאֲדֻמִּים כַּשָּׁנִי. וַאֲנִי תְפִלָּתִי לְךָ יְהֹוָה עֵת רָצוֹן. אֱלֹהִים בְּרָב חַסְדֶּךָ עֲנֵנִי בֶּאֱמֶת:\par }{Fulfill the promise to Jacob and the kindness to the children of Abraham, \textit{“\textup{אַב הַמוׄנִי}“ Abraham is called “\textup{אַב הַמוׄן גוׄיִם}“ (Gen. 17, 5) “a father of a multitude of nations.} for as a result of Your love for us You called us “My firstborn son.” Make white our sins that are red as the red thread. \textit{The red thread that was tied to the goat that was sent to Azazel on Yom Kippur which miraculously turned white as a sign that our sins were forgiven (v. Lev. chap. 16).} Let my prayer to You, Adonoy be a time of acceptance. God, in Your abundant kindness respond to me with true {[salvation]}.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{אַל תָּבֹא בְּמִשְׁפָּט עִמָּנוּ כִּי לֹא יִצְדַּק לְפָנֶֽיךָ כָּל חָי: כִּי עִמְּךָ הַסְּלִיחָה לְמַעַן תִּוָּרֵא: כִּי־עִמְּךָ מְקוֹר חַיִּים, בְּאוֹרְךָ נִרְאֶה־אוֹר׃ חַיִּים וָחֶסֶד תַּעֲשֶׂה עִמָּנוּ וּפְקֻדָּתְךָ תִּשְׁמוֹר רוּחֵנוּ׃ חַיִּים נִשְׁאַל מִמְּךָ תִּתֶּן לָנוּ, אֹרֶךְ יָמִים עוֹלָם וָעֶד׃\par }{Do not enter into judgment with us, for no living soul will be justified before You. For with You is forgiveness, in order that You be feared. For with You is the source of life, {[and]} in Your light shall we see light. {[Grant us]} life, and do kindness with us, and let Your precepts preserve our spirit. We ask of You, life, grant us length of days, forever.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לב. {\small על פי א״ב:} \par }{}
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{חַיִּים אֲרוּכִים} תִּכְתְּבֵנוּ נְטוֹעַ בְּלִי לַעֲקוֹר. בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ עַל כִּסֵּא מַעֲשִֹים לִסְקוֹר. הַטּוֹב צְפֵה וְהָרַע אַל תַּחְקוֹר. כִּי עִמְּךָ מְקוֹר חַיִּים:\par }{Inscribe us for long life and let us not be uprooted. As You sit upon Your throne examining all actions in Your judgment, view only the good and do not examine the evil; for with You is the source of life. \textit{You dispense life.}}
\hebeng{חַיִּים בִּרְצוֹנוֹ וְרֶגַע בְּאַפּוֹ נִרְאֵית. לֹא לָנֶצַח תָּרִיב נַחֲלַת הַנִּלְאֵית. הַשְׁמִיעֵנִי נָא סָלַחְתִּי עָוֹן לָשֵֹאת. רְאֵה נָתַתִּי לְפָנֶיךָ הַיּוֹם אֶת הַחַיִּים:\par }{You dispense life when You are willing while Your period of anger is fleeting. Do not punish until eternity your weary inheritance (Israel). Let me hear the clarion, “I forgive!” as You forgive my sins, and {[also let me hear]} “I’ve granted you today the gift of life!”}
\hebeng{חַיִּים גְּאֹל מִשַּׁחַת תְּעַטְּרֵנִי חֶסֶד אֶזְרָח. וֶאֱמֶת יַשְׁרֵשׁ יַעֲקֹב יָצִיץ וּפָרַח. תַּרְחִיק פְּשָׁעֵינוּ כִּרְחֹק מַעֲרָב מִמִּזְרָח. תּוֹדִיעֵנוּ אֹרַח חַיִּים:\par }{Grant us life and redeem us from ruin. Wrap me with the kindness of Abraham \textit{Abraham, the patriarch, is sometimes referred to as “Ezrach,” e.g. Ayson Haezrachi.} and with the truth that was rooted in Jacob, he planted it and it flourished {[in Israel]}. Distance our sins from us as west is distant from east. Make known to us the truth path of life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים דְּבָרְךָ יַדְּעֵנוּ אֵל גִּבּוֹר וְיוֹעֵץ. לְהִדָּבֵק בְּתוֹרָתְךָ אוֹתָנוּ בְּטוֹבָה לְהִוָּעֵץ. הַגְבֵּר טוֹב עַל צְפוֹנִי לְהַרְעֵץ. לִשְׁמֹר אֶת דֶּרֶךְ עֵץ הַחַיִּים:\par }{Make known to us Your living Word \textit{The Torah gives life to those who uphold it.} Almighty, powerful and {[wise]} Counselor— {[motivate us]} to cling to Your Torah; His advice is for our own benefit. Make the good inclination triumph over the evil inclination and shatter it in order that we preserve the way of the Tree of Life. \textit{The Torah.}}
\hebeng{חַיִּים הִיא לַמַּחֲזִיקִים בָּהּ וְרִפְאוּת וּמֵרוּחַ. תּוֹמְכֶיהָ מְאֻשָּׁרִים בְּאוֹר זָרוּעַ זָרוּחַ. וְכָל הַדָּבֵק בָּהּ יִהְיֶה סָרוּחַ. כָּל בָּשָֹר אֲשֶׁר בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים:\par }{The Torah sustains those who hold it. It is a cure and antidote for sickness. The supporters of Torah are also fortunate to bask in the expanding radiance of Torah. Those who cling to the way of Torah, have an added quality to their lives over all other living flesh.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים וְשָׁלוֹם תִּסְמְכֵנוּ בְּיִרְאָה אוֹתְךָ לַעֲבֹד. וְנָגִילָה וְנִשְֹמְחָה בָךְ רְשָׁעִים בַּאֲבֹד. שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וַעֲשָֹרָה אוֹתָנוּ לִזְבֹּד. יִרְאַת יְהֹוָה עֹשֶׁר וְכָבוֹד וְחַיִּים:\par }{Support us with life and peace that we may serve You in reverence. We shall be glad and rejoice in You when the wicked are destroyed. May the three hundred ten worlds \textit{Which are reserved for the righteous.} be our portion and grant us the reverence of God {[which leads]} to wealth, honor, and life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים זְבָדַנִי זֶבֶד טוֹב גְּדוֹל הָעֵצָה. מַחֲסֶה לָנוּ עֶזְרָה בְצָרוֹת נִמְצָא. שׁוּבָה אֵלַי וְאָשׁוּבָה אָמַר בְּפִיצָה. כִּי מוֹצְאִי מָצָא חַיִּים:\par }{He granted us a fortunate portion in life, He Who provides advice and thoughts, He Who is a refuge to us, and a helper during times of travail. “Return to me and I shall return to you,” He says as He opens His mouth, “Because he who finds Me, discovers life.”}
\hebeng{חַיִּים חִנָּם חָנֵּנִי אֵל אֱלֹהֵי הָרוּחוֹת. עָוֹן תִּמְחוֹל חָרוּת עַל הַלֻּחוֹת. וְשֹוֹנְאֶיךָ יִלְבְּשׁוּ בֹּשֶׁת בְּיִסּוּר תּוֹכָחוֹת. לֹא יְשׁוּבוּן וְלֹא יַשִּׂיגוּ אָרְחוֹת חַיִּים:\par }{Grant me the gift of undeserved life, Almighty, Who knows our thoughts. Forgive the iniquities that are engraved upon tablets, and Your enemies will be cloaked in shame as You punish them in rebuke. They will not repent or comprehend the {[true]} paths of life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים טוֹבִים גְמוֹל לַעֲבָדֶיךָ נַפְשָׁם לִגְאוֹל. מֵרְאוֹת שַׁחַת כְּנָם נִשְׁאַל נִשְׁאוֹל. לֹא כֵן הָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁפָּרְקוּ עוֹל. יַשִּׁיא מָוֶת עָלֵימוֹ יֵרְדוּ שְׁאוֹל חַיִּים:\par }{Bestow good life to Your servants. Redeem their souls from Gehenom just as You granted King David his request. \textit{See Psalms 21, 5.} Not so, for the wicked who rejected You, send the angel of death unto them in order that they descend to their graves.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים יוֹדוּךָ כָּמוֹנוּ וְלֹא קְרוּצֵי קֶרֶץ. אָב לַבָּנִים יוֹדִיעַ שִׁבְחֲךָ בְּמֶרֶץ. וַאֲנַחְנוּ נְבָרֵךְ יָהּ שִׁבְחֲךָ לְהַעֲרֵץ. לִרְאוֹת בְּטוּב יְהֹוָה בְּאֶרֶץ הַחַיִּים:\par }{Those of us who are alive can thank You, but not those who are severed from life. A father informs his children of Your praises in his conversation. And we bless You, God, Your praise we extoll, that we may merit to see God’s goodness upon us in the land of life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים כֻּלְּכֶם הַיּוֹם תַּשְׁמִיעַ טֶרֶף חֻקָּם. מֵחַטָּאתָם טַהֲרֵם וְאַל תְּשִׁיבֵם רֵיקָם. מִמְתִים יָדְךָ יְהֹוָה מַלֵּא סִפְּקָם. מִמְתִים מֵחֶלֶד חֶלְקָם בַּחַיִּים:\par }{Let us hear today: “That you all will live” with the proper allotment of sustenance. Purify them from their sins and don’t turn them away empty-handed. Those decreed for death are in Your hands Adonoy, sustain them for life, and even those destined for death because of old age, grant them a portion amongst the living.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים לְמַעְלָה לְמַשְֹכִּיל לְמַעַן סוּר מֵחֶרֶךְ. אַךְ אֱלֹהִים יִפְדֶּה נַפְשִׁי מִפֶּרֶךְ. וִיחִי עוֹד לָנֶצַח לְיָמִים אוֹרֶךְ. כִּי נֵר מִצְוָה וְתוֹרָה אוֹר וְדֶרֶךְ חַיִּים:\par }{Life is an attribute for the discerning person because through the life of Torah he can distant himself from Gehinom. Therefore, please God, redeem my soul from a broken body and let it live forever and for long life; For the mitzvah is a lamp and the Torah is light and the way to achieve life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים מִסֵּפֶר יִמָּחוּ גְבָל וּמוֹאָב הַגְּבוֹהִים. לְבוּל עֵץ סוֹגְדִים וְקוֹדִים וּמַאֲלִיהִים. בַּל יֻחַן רָשָׁע הַמַּדְכֶּה יִדוֹן בְּשִׁלּוּהִים. כִּי חֵרֵף מַעַרְכוֹת אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים:\par }{Erase from the book of life Gival and Moav who are now exalted though they bow down to a block of wood and proclaim it to be a god. Do not grant kindness to the wicked who afflict us; let them be sentenced for destruction because they disgrace Israel who are the legions of the eternal God.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים נִשְׁבַּעְתָּ בּוֹ לְבִנְךָ יְחִידֶךָ. שַׁעַר אוֹיְבָיו לְהַנְחִילוֹ תַּתָּה בְּיָדֶךָ. אָנַפְתָּ וְתָשׁוּב עַל כֵּן אוֹדֶךָ. כִּי טוֹב חַסְדְּךָ מֵחַיִּים:\par }{You swore to give life to Your only son (Isaac), the gates of his enemies was to be the inheritance of his descendants through You they would fall in his hands. Despite Your anger, You will again grant us mercy and, therefore, I thank You, for Your kindness is greater than life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים שׂוֹבַע שְֹמָחוֹת אֶת פָּנֶיךָ נוֹרָאוֹת. חַדֵּשׁ יָמֵינוּ חֵן חֵן תְּשׁוּאוֹת. תָּשׁוּב תְּרַחֲמֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת. כִּי מִמֶּנּוּ תּוֹצְאוֹת חַיִּים:\par }{{[Instruct us in the path of true life]} in order that we be satiated with joy when we see Your wondrous face. \textit{A reference to the Divine Presence, (Shechinah).} Renew our days like in times of old and people will see our graciousness. Return and have mercy upon us, Adonoy, God of Hosts because from You emanates life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים עַל הָאֲדָמָה יְבֻשַּׂר עַמְּךָ מִמְּעוֹנוֹת. וְתַשְׁלִיךְ בִּמְצוּלוֹת יָם חֵטְא וַעֲוֹנוֹת. לֵב טָהוֹר בְּרָא לָנוּ וְהַמְצִיאֵנוּ חֲנִינוֹת. אֹרֶךְ יָמִים וּשְׁנוֹת חַיִּים:\par }{Let life on earth be decreed for Your people from the heavens and cast into the depths of the sea all of our sins and iniquities. Create for us a pure heart and grant us the kindnesses of many days and years of life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים פִּי צַדִּיק וּפִי רְשָׁעִים מְחִתָּה. בְּקָצְבְּךָ מִלְחָמוֹת וְשָׁלוֹם וּפַלָּצוּת וּבְעָתָה. שוֹבַע וְרָזוֹן וְחִיל הַחַיִּים וְהַמָּוְתָה. הַבְּרָכָה וְהַקְּלָלָה וּבָחַרְתָּ בַּחַיִּים:\par }{Grant life to the righteous one and to the wicked dispense fear. When on Rosh Hashana You decree wars, or peace or fears and trembling, a year of plenty or famine, terror, life, or death, a year of blessing or curse, choose for us the portion of life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים צְדָקָה וְכָבוֹד תַּגְדִּיל לְיָפָה כְּתִרְצָה. הַזּוֹרַעַת חֶסֶד וְקוֹצֶרֶת בְּלִי שִׁמְצָה. תְּכוֹנֵן צַדִּיק יְהֹוָה וּגְדוֹר פִּרְצָה. רֹדֵף צְדָקָה וָחֶסֶד יִמְצָא חַיִּים:\par }{A life of righteousness and dignity grant her \textit{Israel.} who is beautiful and amenable, who does kindness with others, privately, without causing the recipient shame. Adonoy make the righteous one secure and fulfill his needs. He who pursues righteousness and kindness will himself find life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים קַיָּמִים תַּנְחִילֵנוּ וְחָכְמָה וָדַעַת בְּמוֹעֲצוֹת. שָֹשֹוֹן וְשִֹמְחָה תַּשְׁמִיעַ מֵעִיר חֻצוֹת. וְהַעֲבֵר מֵעָלַי עָוֹן וְהַלְבֵּשׁ מַחֲלָצוֹת. אֶתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵי יְהֹוָה בְּאַרְצוֹת הַחַיִּים:\par }{Grant us the inheritance of eternal life (Torah) given with Divine wisdom and advice. Let gladness and rejoicing be heard from the streets of Jerusalem; and remove iniquity from us and garb us with fresh clothing (Torah). I will then go before God in the lands of life. \textit{Israel.}}
\hebeng{חַיִּים רְאֵה עַם סְגֻלָּתְךָ כְּקֶדֶם לִמְתוֹב. לֹא תַחְפּוֹץ בְּמוֹת הַמֵּת עַד דִיתוֹב. נִשְׁבָּר וְנִדְכֶּה לְפָנֶיךָ חָשׁוּב הַטּוֹב. קָדוֹשׁ יֵאָמֶר לוֹ כָּל הַכָּתוּב לְחַיִּים:\par }{See fit, God, to grant life to Your people who are Your treasure, let them return to serve you as previously. \textit{In the days of the Holy Temple.} You do not desire the death of the sinner but rather that he repent. A broken and pained heart is considered precious before You. Therefore say to them that they are holy include them among those inscribed for life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים שָׁאַל מִמְּךָ נָתַתָּה לוֹ חַיֵּיהוּ מִיּוֹמַיִם. גָדוֹל כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּישׁוּעָתֶךָ כִּיפַת פַּעֲמַיִם. הַשְׁקִיפָה מִמְּעוֹן קָדְשְׁךָ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם. בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יֵצְאוּ מַיִם חַיִּים:\par }{When {[David]} requested life from You, You granted it to him. \textit{When Moshiach Ben David sees that Moshiach Ben Yosef is killed he will ask God for life, and God will grant him that request because of King David’s prayer. See Succah 52.} Grant him life now as You did then. His glory will be great in Your salvation {[just as the glory of Israel was great]} as they ascended to Jerusalem at festivals. Look from the dwelling place of Your holiness from the heavens {[to save us]}. On that day spring water will flow from Jerusalem.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים תַּאֲוָה בָּאָה סְלוֹחַ אֶל חַטֹּאתֵכֶם. תַּשְׁמִיעַ וְאֶת רוּחִי אֶתֵּן בְּקִרְבְּכֶם. לֵאמֹר מָצָאתִי כוֹפֶר. רָצִיתִי אֶתְכֶם. וְאַתֶּם הַדְּבֵקִים בַּיהֹוָה אֱלֹהֵיכֶם חַיִּים:\par }{You desire to grant life and to forgive their sins. Let it be heard: “And My spirit, I will place among you” saying that I found atonement {[for you]}. I wish to accept you because you truly cling to Adonoy, Your God, Who lives eternally.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים מִמְּךָ הָאֵל סָמְכָה יוֹנָתְךָ הַמְשׁוּכָה אַחֲרֶיךָ. לְהִדָּבֵק בְּךָ כַּדָּת וְכַהֲלָכָה. תְּבִיאֵנוּ לְהַר צִיּוֹן וְתָשִׁיב הַמְּלוּכָה. כִּי שָׁם צִוָּה יְהֹוָה אֶת הַבְּרָכָה חַיִּים:\par }{Almighty, with life support Your dove (Israel) who follows You to cling to Your laws. Bring us to Mount Zion and restore the kingship because from there Adonoy commands (and sends forth) the blessing of life.}
\hebeng{חַיִּים מִמֶּנּוּ נוֹחִיל וְלִישׁוּעָתוֹ קִוִּינוּ. עַתָּה יַרְחִיב יְהֹוָה לָנוּ וּפָרִינוּ. יְחַיֵּינוּ מִיּוֹמַיִם בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי יְקִימֵנוּ. אֲנַחְנוּ אֵלֶּה פֹה הַיּוֹם כֻּלָּנוּ חַיִּים:\par }{We await life from Him and hope for His deliverance. At this time Adonoy will expand our territory enabling us to increase and multiply. From the destruction of the two temples He will resurrect us and build the third Temple, and all those who are before You today shall remain amongst the living.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{אַל תָּבֹא בְּמִשְׁפָּט עִמָּנוּ כִּי לֹא יִצְדַּק לְפָנֶֽיךָ כָּל חָי: וְאַתָּה אֲדוֹנֵינוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ עֵינֵי כָל יִשְׂרָאֵל עָלֶיךָ: יְהוָֹה מֶלֶךְ יְהוָֹה מָלָךְ יְהוָֹה יִמְלֹךְ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד: אַתָּה הוּא מַלְכֵּנוּ מִקֶּדֶם פֹּעֵל יְשׁוּעוֹת בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ׃ אַתָּה־הוּא מַלְכֵּנוּ אֱלֹהִים צַוֵּה יְשׁוּעוֹת יַעֲקֹב׃ וְהָיָה יְהוָֹה לְמֶלֶךְ עַל־כָּל־הָאָרֶץ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה יְהוָֹה אֶחָד וּשְׁמוֹ אֶחָד׃}{Do not enter into judgment with us, for no living being will be justified before You. And now our Master, the King, the eyes of all Israel are on You. Adonoy is King, Adonoy was King, Adonoy will be King forever and ever. You are our King from of old, You effect deliverances in the midst of the earth. You are our King, God, command the deliverance of Jacob. And it will be on that day, that Adonoy will be King over the whole earth, on that day Adonoy will be One and His Name One.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לג. {\small על פי א״ב:} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Joel ben Isaac Halevi.}} }
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד יִהְיֶה אֶל־הָעַמִּים מֵרִים נִסַּי. הַשָּׂם פְּקֻדָּתִי שָׁלוֹם וְלִצְדָקָה נוֹגְשַׂי. אֵלָיו אֶתְוַדָּע וְאֹמַר אַיֵּה אֱלוֹהַּ עֹשָׂי. אוֹמֵר אָנִי מַעֲשַׂי לְמֶלֶךְ:\par }{One King will rule {[all]} the nations, He {[God]} will raise my banner, \textit{Of redemption.} He will cause those appointed to tax me to seek my peace, and my oppressors to deal righteously. I will make it known to him when I say, “Where is God Who made me?” I say, “My deeds are in honor of the King.”}
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ בְּמִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִיד עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל. עַל־כֵּן קִדַּמְתִּי לִבְרֹחַ אֶת־פְּנֵי הָאֵל. אֲנִי וּנְעָרַי אָצוּם כֵּן, הֱיוֹת תַּחֲנוּנִים שׁוֹאֵל. וּבְכֵן אָבוֹא אֶל־הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{The King will call to judgement His people Israel {[on Rosh Hashana]}, therefore, I hasten to flee {[from evil]} {[and seek]} the Presence of the Almighty. I and my young men will fast, and plead with supplications, and thus will I go into the King.}
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ גָּדוֹל עַל־כָּל־אֱלֹהִים שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ קוֹנֶה. סָבִיב לִירֵאָיו מַלְאָךְ יְהֹוָה חוֹנֶה. מַלְאֲכֵי רַחֲמִים חַלּוּ־נָא לשׁוֹכְנִי סְנֶה. הַסָּרִיסִים הַמְשָׁרְתִים אֶת־פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{The King is greater than all gods, He is the possessor of heaven and earth, around those who fear Him, the angel of Adonoy encamps; Angels of mercy! Please entreat Him Who appeared in the {[burning]} bush, and also you angels who serve in the Presence of the King.}
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ דָּבָר אַל־תַּפֵּל מִכָּל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּרְתָּ לְחַזֵּק אֶת־בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, וְכַרְמְךָ לְסַקֵּל וּלְעַזֵּק. אַמֵּץ סַנֵּגוֹר וְהַס קַטֵּגוֹר וְלֹא יְנַזֵּק. כִּי אֵין הַצָּר שֹׁוֶה בְּנֵזֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! Leave out nothing that You have promised: to repair the breaches of the house, \textit{The House of Israel.} to remove the stones from Your vineyard \textit{Remove the sins, the stumbling blocks from Israel.} and to erect a fence around it; strengthen the advocate and silence the accuser, so that he does no damage, for the adversary is not worthy of the King’s loss.}
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ הַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ רְאֵה עֲווֹנוֹת לָשֵּׂאת. בְּמַשְׂטִין תִּגְעַר לְהָבִיא הַשֶּׁבֶר וְהַשֵּׁאת. וְיֵצֵא חָפוּר מֵרֹב פַּחַד וּשְׂאֵת. כִּי כָלְתָה אֵלָיו הָרָעָה מֵאֵת הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! see what is good in Your eyes— forgive our iniquities, rebuke the seducer {[Satan]} let destruction and ruin come upon him; let him withdraw disgraced before {[Your]} great terror and awe; let the evil decree against him be final from the King’s will.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ וְדָתוֹ מַגִּיעַ כְּחֹק יוֹם לְהֵרָשֵׁם. לָדִין עַמִּים צַדִּיק וְחוֹטֵא וְאָשֵׁם. וְעַתָּה יִקָּרְאוּ סוֹפְרֵי־הַמֶּלֶךְ הָעוֹצֵר וְהַגּוֹשֵׁם. כִּתְבוּ עַל־הַיְּהוּדִים כַּטּוֹב בְּעֵינֵיכֶם בְּשֵׁם הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{The King and His command approaches on the day when judgment is recorded, He judges the peoples, the righteous, the sinner and the guilty; and now let the King’s scribes be called, those who cause drought and make rain, and let them inscribe for the Jews whatever You desire in the King’s Name.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ זֹהַר חַמָּה תַּחְפִּיר וְיֵבֹשׁוּ עוֹבְדֵי־נְבוֹ. וְיִמְאֲסוּן אִישׁ אֱלִילֵי־כַסְפּוֹ וְאִישׁ אֱלִילֵי זְהָבוֹ. כִּי־עַיִן בְּעַיִן יִרְאוּ לְצִיּוֹן בְּשׁוּבוֹ. וְהִנָּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבוֹא מֶלֶךְ:\par }{O King! Put to shame the sun’s brilliance, \textit{So that men will not worship it.} and let the worshippers of Nebo be disgraced, let man despise his idols of silver and his idols of gold; for they will see with their eyes His {[God’s]} return to Zion, and be uplifted doors to eternity so that the King may enter.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ חָכָם מְזָרֶה רָשָׁע וְגַם בַּעַר. וַיָּשֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶם אוֹפָן וּבָהֶם יִגְעַר. גָּרֵשׁ־לֵץ וְיֵצֵא מָדוֹן וּפִיהוּ לֹא־יִפְעַר. כִּי אֵין לָבוֹא אֶל שַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{The wise King Who scatters the wicked and also the empty-headed, and turns the wheel upon them \textit{He punishes them.} and rebukes them— cast out the scorner {[Satan]}, and let strife depart, that he not open his mouth {[against us]}; {[and say to him]}: “That he is forbidden to enter the King’s gate.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ־טוֹב יֵצֵא דְּבַר־מַלְכוּת מִלְּפָנָיו מְיֻסָּד. רַגְלֵי־בָנַי אֶשְׁמֹר וְלֹא־אָשִׂים אוֹתָם בַּסָּד. בְּיוֹם הַמּוּכָן לָדִין מִי־יִצְלַח וּמִי־יִפְסַד. כִּי כֵן יִסַּד הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{If it pleases the King let there go forth a royal edict from Him based on the following: “I will guard the feet of my children, and will not put them in stockades \textit{To torture them.} on the day set for judging who shall prosper and who shall fail,” for so has the King ordained.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ יוֹשֵׁב עַל־כִּסֵּא־דִּין קָטוֹן וְגָדוֹל מַשְׁלֵב. וְרוֹאֶה מִי־שָׁב בְּכָל־לֵב וּמִי־שָׁב כְּכֶלֶב. נְקֹם נִקְמַת הַנֶעֱלָב מִן הָעוֹלֵב. בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי כְּטוֹב לֵב־הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{The King sits on the throne of judgment, small and great, He reviews as one, and discerns who is truly penitent and who returns like a dog; \textit{He who returns to his sin as a dog who returns to his vomit.} He will avenge the offended {[Israel]} from the offender {[its oppressors]} in the seventh month {[Tishrei]} when the heart of the King is benevolent.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ כָּל הָאָרֶץ הָאֵל הָעוֹנֶה אוֹתִי בְּיוֹם־צָרָתִי, וַיְהִי עִמָּדִי בְּכָל־מַחֲנֶה. וָעֶד סֶלָה יְסוֹבְבֵנִי פַלֵּט רָנֵּי. אִם מָצָאתִי חֵן בְּעֵינֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{The King of all the earth, the Almighty Who answers me in the day of my distress, and Who was with me every time I was encircled by enemy camps, may He continue forever to surround me with glad songs of rescue, when I find favor in the eyes of the King.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת יְקָר יוֹתֵר לַעֲבָדֶיךָ הוֹאֵל. תִּיקַר־נָא נַפְשָׁם בְּעֵינֶיךָ לַמְּלָכִים לְמוֹאֵל. לִרְאוֹת בְּבוֹא כָל־יִשְׂרָאֵל. כָּל־אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה אֲשֶׁר יָבוֹא אֶל־הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! Grant superior honor to Your servants {[Israel]}, let their lives be precious in Your eyes for they are children of the Almighty’s kings, \textit{\textup{שֶׁהֵם נִקְרָאִים בְּנֵי מְלָכִים}—sons of kings.} and see how the whole of Israel every man and woman come before the King {[in judgment]}.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ מְשָׁרְתָיו יְבַקְּשׁוּ פָנָיו בְתַעֲנִית וּטְוַת. הַמֻּתְרִים כָּל־הַנוֹגֵעַ בָּהֶם כְּנוֹגֵעַ בָּבַת. וְהִנֵּה עֵשָׂו מְעַנָּם, אֱמוֹר־לוֹ, בֶּן־נַעֲוַת, מַדּוּעַ אַתָּה עוֹבֵר אֶת מִצְוַת הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! His servants seek His Presence with fasting and affliction {[saying]}, “The nations have been warned, whoever touches them {[Israel]} touches the apple of His eye;” and behold Esau oppresses them, say to him, “Perverse one, why do you transgress the King’s command?”}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ נוֹרָא עַד מָתַי אָסַפְתָּ בְּמִשְׁמָר. בְּנֵי זֶרַח וָפֶרֶץ תְּאוֹמֵי תָמָר. מַלְכוּתָם הָשֵׁב וַעֲדִינָה תְעַקֵּר כְּנֶאֱמַר. עַל אֲשֶׁר לֹא־עָשְׂתָה אֶת־מַאֲמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{Awesome King! How long will You imprison the children of Zorach and Peretz, the twins of Tamar? \textit{The sons of Judah from where the royal House of David were descended and from whence the Messiah will come.} Restore their kingdom and uproot Amalek as it is said {[in Your Torah, see Deut 25:19]}; for she has not kept the word {[command]} of the King.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ שָׂרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו יַקִּיפוּהוּ בְּאַרְמוֹנִי. יִרְעוּ בָשָׁן וְגִלְעָד לְבָדָד שׁוֹכְנִי. רְעֵה עַמְּךָ בְּשִׁבְטֶךָ לָרְוָיָה תוֹצִיאֵנִי. אַתָּה אֲדוֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! May His princes and servants surround Him in His Palace {[the Holy Temple]}, let them dwell in Bashan and Gilead, let them dwell alone {[in security]}; lead Your people with Your scepter, take us out into abundance, You my Master, the King.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ עֵינֵי כָל־יִשְׂרָאֵל עָלֶיךָ לְקַבֵּץ הֲמוֹנַי. עוֹד יֵשְׁבוּ בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם זְקֵנוֹתַי וּזְקֵינַי. וְאָז יַעַבְדוּךָ יַחַד כֹּהֲנַי וּסְגָנַי. וְהָיָה יְהֹוָה לְמֶלֶךְ:\par }{O King! The eyes of all Israel are upon You, to gather my multitude, may they yet dwell in the gates of Jerusalem, my aged women and men; and then, together they will serve You my Priests and my deputy Priests, and Adonoy will be King.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ פְּאֵר בֵּית יְהֹוָה עֵינַי יְשַׂבֵּרוּן. וְכָל הָעָם יַחַד לְשִׁמְךָ יַאֲדִירוּן. אָז־יִמָּלֵא שְׂחוֹק פִּינוּ וְהַכֹּל יְשׁוֹרֵרוּן. וַיְהִי בִישֻׁרוּן מֶלֶךְ:\par }{O King! The magnificence of the House of Adonoy, my eyes long to behold, and the whole people together will magnify Your Name; then will our mouths be filled with laughter, and all will joyfully sing: “{[God]} will be King in Jeshurun.”}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ צָרַי יָגִילוּ, עַד מָתַי הָאֵל. גָּדְלוּ וְהִצְלִיחוּ וְהֶחֱרִיבוּ אֲרִיאֵל. הִנֵּה הֵמָּה אוֹמְרִים יָדֵנוּ לָאֵל. וַאֲנִי לֹא נִקְרֵאתִי לָבוֹא אֶל־הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! {[How long]} will my enemies exult? How long will they prevail? They have grown and prospered and destroyed the Holy Temple; behold they say: “Our hands are mighty,” and I have not been called to come to the King.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ קָם בַּחֲמָתוֹ לְכַלּוֹת כִּמְדֻבָּר. אוֹכְלֵי בְּשַׂר הַחֲזִיר הַשֶּׁקֶץ וְהָעַכְבָּר. יָרִיעַ אַף יַצְרִיחַ עַל־אוֹיְבָיו יִתְגַּבָּר. כִּי כֵן דְּבַר הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King! Rise in Your {[lit. His]} anger to destroy as You promised those who eat the flesh of swine, {[and]} the {[other]} abominated animals and mice; let Him trumpet and shout, He will prevail over His enemies, for this is the promise of the King.}
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ רַב, הָסֵר מִמֶּנּוּ לֵב הָאֶבֶן. כַּשֶּׁלֶג וְכַצֶּמֶר חַטָּאֵינוּ הַלְבֵּן. וְדַבְּקֵנוּ בְּךָ כְּמוֹ אֹדֶם לְלֹבֶן. מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ לְמֶלֶךְ תֵּן וְצִדְקָתְךָ לְבֶן־מֶלֶךְ:\par }{O Great King, remove from us the heart of stone, whiten our sins like snow and wool, that we may cling to You like the red to the white; \textit{The yolk of the egg to the albumen.} grant the king {[Moshiach]} Your justice and Your righteousness to the king’s son{[s]}. \textit{The Children of Israel are called the \textit{sons of kings} (\textup{בְּנֵי מְלָכִים}).}}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ שׁוֹפֵט בֶּאֱמֶת דַּלִּים, אַתָּה תֶחֱזֶה כִּי שָׁבַרְנוּ גְּאוֹן רוּחֵנוּ כְּהַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. לֵב נִשְׁבָּר וְנִדְכֶּה אֱלֹהִים לֹא־תִבְזֶה. הַמְּלָאכָה לְהָבִיא אֶל גִּנְזֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King Who faithfully judges the poor, You see that the pride of our spirit is broken \textit{We are no longer haughty or arrogant.} even this day. A broken and humbled heart You, God, will not despise; {[therefore]} deposit our works \textit{Our repentance and good deeds.} in the treasury of the King.}
\hebeng{מֶלֶךְ תֵּן צִדְקָתְךָ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי נַעַר. לְהִדָּבֵק בּוֹ אִישׁ וְלוֹיוֹת כְּמַעַר. לֹא תִבְזֶה וְתִפְנֶה אֶל־תְּפִלַּת הָעַרְעָר. וְכָל עַבְדֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲשֶׁר בְּשַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ:\par }{O King grant Your righteousness to Israel, for he is a tender youth, cling to him, as a man clings to his wife; do not despise him, but turn to the prayer of the destitute, and to all the servants of the King who are at the gate of the King.}
\hebeng{הַמֶּלֶךְ לְהִתְחַנֵּן לוֹ בָּאתִי אוֹתִי לְהַתְווֹת לְחַיִּים טוֹבִים, מִדֶּשֶׁן בֵּיתוֹ לְהַרְווֹת. כָּל־הַגּוֹיִם לְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה לְהַקְווֹת. וְעָלוּ מִדֵּי שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה לְהִשְׁתַּחֲווֹת לְמֶלֶךְ:\par }{O King, I have come to beseech Him, to inscribe me for a good life, from the abundance of His House, to be filled, let all nations gather in the Name of God, and let them go up every year to bow in worship to the King.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{אַל תָּבֹא בְּמִשְׁפָּט עִמָּנוּ כִּי לֹא יִצְדַּק לְפָנֶֽיךָ כָּל חָי: הֵן בִּקְדֹשָׁיו לֹא יַאֲמִין וְשָׁמַיִם לֹא־זַכּוּ בְעֵינָיו׃ אַף כִּי־אֱנוֹשׁ רִמָּה וּבֶן־אָדָם תּוֹלֵעָה׃ הִנְנוּ לְפָנֶיךָ בְּאַשְׁמָתֵינוּ כִּי אֵין לַעֲמוֹד לְפָנֶיךָ עַל־זֹאת׃ מִי־יֹאמַר זִכִּיתִי לִבִּי טָהַרְתִּי מֵחַטָּאתִי׃\par }{Do not enter into judgment with us, for no living soul will be justified before You. Even in His holy ones, He does not trust, and the heavens are not innocent in His eyes. Even more, since man is but a worm and the son of man a maggot. Behold we are guilty in Your Presence, we are not worthy to stand in Your Presence because of this. Who cay say: “My heart is pure, I have cleansed it from sin.”}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לד. {\small על פי א״ב. חתום מחברו יצחק הכהן החבר חזק ואמץ:} \par }{}
\hebeng{אָדוֹן בְּפָקְדְךָ אֱנוֹשׁ לַבְּקָרִים, בְּמִצּוּי הַדִּין אַל־תִּמְתַּח: גּוּף וּנְשָׁמָה אִם־תְּרִיבֵם, דֹּחוּ וְלֹא־יוּכְלוּ קוּם:\par }{Master, when You call on man each morning {[for judgment]} do not press justice to its limits. If You combine body and soul {[in judgment]} they would be thrust down and be unable to rise.}
\hebeng{הֲיוּכַל גֶּבֶר לִזְכּוֹת בַּמִּשְׁפָּט, וְאִם יֵשׁ בְּיָדוֹ מַעַשֹ לְהִצְטַדָּק: זֵרוּי יִחוּמוֹ מִלֵּחָה סְרוּחָה, חָבוּי אָרְבּוֹ בְּקִרְבּוֹ מֵעֵת הִוָּלְדוֹ:\par }{Can man be innocent in judgement? Is he possessed of deeds to justify him? His birth stream is from a fetid drop, his enemy is hidden within him from the time of his birth.}
\hebeng{טָמוּן בְּחֻבּוֹ כְרֶשֶׁת לְרַגְלָיו, יְסִיתֵהוּ בְכָל־יוֹם לְשַׁחַת לְהַפִּילוֹ: כֹּחַ וּגְבוּרָה בַּגּוּף אָיִן לְפָנָיו לַעֲמֹד וּלְהִתְיַצֵּב:\par }{Lurking within him as a snare to his feet, he entices him daily, to make him fall into the abyss {[of sin]}; there is no power or might in the body to stand firm and resist him.}
\hebeng{מִיּוֹם עָמְדוֹ עַל־דַּעְתּוֹ, נַפְשׁוֹ יָשִֹים בְּכַפּוֹ לְהָבִיא לַחְמוֹ: שָֹבֵעַ כָּל־יָמָיו כַּעַס וּמַכְאוֹבוֹת, עַד־שׁוּבוֹ לַעֲפָרוֹ לֹא־יִשְׁקֹט:\par }{From the day he attains perception, he puts his life in his hand to gain his bread, all his days are filled with vexation and grief; until he returns to his dust he is not at rest.}
\hebeng{פְּנֵה אָדוֹן בְּעִצְבוֹן־רוּחַ, צְפֵה בְּשִׁבְרוֹן־לֵב: קָרוֹב אַתָּה לָרְחוֹקִים, רוֹצֶה תְּשׁוּבַת־רְשָׁעִים:\par }{Regard O Master his sorrowful spirit, look at his broken heart, You are near to these who are afar, You desire the repentance of the wicked.}
\hebeng{שַׁדַּי, הִמָּצֵא לְדוֹרְשֶׁיךָ, תֹּאמַר הִנֵּנִי לִמְבַקְּשֶׁיךָ: יְבֻשְּׂרוּ סָלַחְתִּי קוֹרְאֵי בִשְׁמֶךָ, צַדֵּק בַּמִּשְׁפָּט עַם־מְיַחֲדֶךָ:\par }{Mighty One! let Yourself be found by those who seek You, say: “Here I am,” to those who petition You let the tiding: “I have pardoned”— be told to those who call in Your Name, make righteous in judgment the people who proclaim Your Unity.}
\hebeng{חֲסֹם מְנֻוָּל מִלְּהַרְשִׁיעַ, קְצֹף בְּמַסְטִין מִלְּהַסְטִין. הָקֵם לָנוּ מֵלִיץ־יֹשֶׁר. כֹּפֶר מָצָאתִי תַּשְׁמִיעַ לְשׁוֹבָבִים:\par }{Muzzle the foul one {[Satan]} that he may not condemn us, rebuke the accuser that he not accuse us, stand up for us an upright advocate; “I have found atonement,” let the penitent hear.}
\hebeng{הִשְׁלַכְנוּ עָלֶיךָ יְהָבֵנוּ, נָא אַתָּה תְכַלְכְּלֵנוּ: הֵעָתֵר לָנוּ בִּתְפִלָּתֵנוּ. חֶפְצֵנוּ וּבַקָּשָׁתֵנוּ מַלֵּא בְרַחֲמִים: בְּךָ תָלִינוּ בִטְחוֹנֵנוּ, רַחֲמֶיךָ מְהֵרָה יְקַדְּמוּנוּ: חָזָק וְאַמִּיץ שִׁמְךָ לֹא־שָׁכָחְנוּ, אָנָּא, לָנֶצַח אַל־תִּשְׁכָּחֵנוּ:\par }{We have cast our burden upon You we beseech You to sustain us, be pleased with our prayer our request and desire fulfill with compassion. In You we place our trust, let Your mercy come swiftly toward us; Strong and Mighty One, we have not forgotten Your Name, we beseech You, never forget us.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{אַל תָּבֹא בְּמִשְׁפָּט עִמָּנוּ כִּי לֹא יִצְדַּק לְפָנֶֽיךָ כָּל חָי: כִּי אָכְלוּ אֶת־יַעֲקֹב וְאֶת־נָוֵהוּ הֵשַׁמּוּ׃ אָהֳלֵי אֱדוֹם וְיִשְׁמְעֵאלִים מוֹאָב וְהַגְרִים׃ כִּי־שָׂבְעָה בְרָעוֹת נַפְשֵׁנוּ וְחַיֵּינוּ לִשְׁאוֹל הִגִּיעוּ׃ וְאַתָּה מַלְכֵּנוּ מִקֶּדֶם פֹּעֵל יְשׁוּעוֹת בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ׃ וְהוֹצֵא כָאוֹר צִדְקֵנוּ וּמִשְׁפְּטֵנוּ כַּצָּהֳרָיִם׃\par }{Do not enter into judgment with us for no living soul will be justified before You. For they have devoured Jacob, and his habitation they have laid waste, the tents {[armies]} of Edom, Ishmael, Moab and Gris. For our souls are filled with misfortune and our lives have reached the abyss. And You are our King from of old, You do wonders in the midst of the earth. Bring forth our righteousness the daylight and our judgment as at noon-time.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לה. {\small על פי א״ת ב״ש. חתום אליה בר שמעיה חזק:} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Elyah ben Shemayah.}} }
\hebeng{אָדוֹן בְּשָׁפְטְךָ אֱנוֹשׁ רִמָּה, תִּזְכֹּר בְּרֹגֶז חַנּוֹת רַחֵם: בְּעָרְכְּךָ דִּין־אֲשֵׁמִים לְוַכֵּחַ, שׁוֹגֶה וָפֶתִי זַכֵּה וְהַצְדֵּק:\par }{Master, when You judge man who is a worm, remember in Your anger to be gracious and compassionate with us, when You sit in judgment to rebuke the guilty, clear and justify the erring and simple.}
\hebeng{גְּמֹל חֶסֶד וְטוֹבָה לְחַיָּבִים, רִיב אַל־תִּמְתַּח לְמִצּוּי: דַּלֵּי־מַעַשֹ וְרֵיקֵי־כִשְׁרוֹן, קוֹרְאִים אֵלֶיךָ לָמוֹ הִמָּצֵא:\par }{Grant kindness and goodness to the guilty, do not press judgment to its limits. {[When]} those who are poor in good deeds and destitute in conduct, call upon You, let them find You.}
\hebeng{הִנְנוּ לְפָנֶיךָ בְּאַשְׁמָה־רַבָּה. צִפְצוּף מַעַן בֹּשְׁנוּ לְפוֹצֵץ: וְאִם מֵאֱלוֹהַּ אֱנוֹשׁ הֲיִצְדַּק, פְּנֵי עֹשֵֹהוּ גֶּבֶר הֲיִטְהָר:\par }{We stand before You with great guilt, we are ashamed to mouth a reply {[excuse]}; can man be justified before God? In the Presence of His Maker, can man be found pure {[innocent]}?}
\hebeng{זָדוֹן בְּחֻבּוֹ אָוֶן בְּקִרְבּוֹ, עָוֹן מָלֵא וָפֶשַׁע־רָב: חֶשְׁבּוֹן וָדִין לְמֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי־הַמְּלָכִים, סוֹפוֹ לִתֵּן בְּבֹא חֲלִיפָתוֹ:\par }{Maliciousness lurks within him, deceit is hidden within him, he is full of iniquity and great transgression, account and reckoning before the Supreme King of Kings, he will have to give at his end.}
\hebeng{טֶבַע חוֹתָם בְּכַפּוֹ נֶחֱרָת, נֶגֶד פָּנָיו רִשְׁעוֹ יַעֲנֶה: יוֹרֶה כָּפִיס מֵעֵץ וְיַגִּיד, מִקִּיר־אֶבֶן תִּזְעַק וְתִקְרָא:\par }{His sins are engraven by his own hand, his wickedness will testify against him, the beams of his house will reveal and declare his deeds, the stone from the wall will scream and call out. \textit{See Mesechet Taanis 11a; Chagigah 16a.}}
\hebeng{כּוֹבֵשׁ פָּנָיו נִדּוֹן וְנִכְלָם, לְאַיִן חָשׁוּב בְּעָמְדוֹ לְפָנֶיךָ: אָנָּא לְמַעֲשֵֹה־יָדֶיךָ הֵרָצֶה, בְּשִׁבְרוֹן רְאֵה שְׁמֹר מִדֶּחִי:\par }{The judged will hide his face in shame, he will be considered as naught when he stands before Your Presence; we beseech You, be pleased with the work of our hands, behold our broken hearts, and preserve us from destruction.}
\hebeng{עֲבָדֶיךָ יִמְצְאוּ הַיּוֹם חֲנִינָה, זַכֵּם קִרְבָתְךָ חֲפוֹץ כְבָרִאשׁוֹנָה: וְכַשֶּׁלֶג וְכַצֶּמֶר הַלְבֵּן חֲטָאֵי־שׁוֹשַׁנָּה, מַלְּטֵם מִכָּל רָעוֹת בְּזֹאת הַשָּׁנָה:\par }{Let Your servants find favor this day, declare them guiltless, they desire Your nearness as of old; like snow and wool whiten the sins of the rose {[Israel]}, save them from all evil in this year.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{יְהוָה בֹּקֶר תִּשְׁמַע קוֹלֵנוּ בֹּקֶר נַעֲרָךְ־לְךָ וּנְצַפֶּה׃ קָרְבָה אֶל־נַפְשֵׁנוּ גְאָלָהּ. לְמַעַן שִׁמְךָ פְּדֵנוּ׃ הַרְאֵנוּ יְהוָה חַסְדֶּךָ וְיֶשְׁעֲךָ תִּתֶּן־לָנוּ׃\par }{Adonoy, hear our voice in the morning, morning, we pray to You and hope. Draw near to our soul and redeem it, redeem us for Your Name’s sake. Show us Your kindness, Adonoy, and grant us Your deliverance.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לו. {\small מיוסד על פי א״ב. חתום שלמה הבבלי.} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Shlomo ben Yehudah Habavli.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֶזְעַק אֶל־אֱלֹהִים} קוֹלִי. בֹּקֶר אֶעֱרָךְ־לְךָ בְּעַד־קְהָלִי. יְהֹוָה צוּרִי וְגֹאֲלִי: גַּשְׁנוּ בְתַחֲנוּן וּבִתְפִלָּה. דְלָתֶיךָ שָׁקַדְנוּ רַב עֲלִילָה. הָסֵר מֵעָלֵינוּ נֶגַע וּמַחֲלָה:\par }{I cry out to God with my voice, in the morning, I address my prayer to You, on behalf of my congregation; Adonoy, my Rock and my Redeemer! We approach You with supplication and prayer, we keep watch at Your door, O Mighty One in wondrous deeds, remove from us, plague and sickness.}
\hebeng{הַמְצֵא־לָנוּ סְלִיחוֹת. וְהַעֲבֵר רָעָה מִנְּפָשׁוֹת הָאֲנוּחוֹת. אֵל אֱלֹהַי הָרוּחוֹת: זָעַקְתִּי־לְךָ בְּעִנּוּי וּתְלָאָה. חַיָּתִי פְּדֵה נָא מִשַּׁחַת וּשְׁאוֹלָה. קָרְבָה אֶל־נַפְשִׁי גְאָלָהּ:\par }{Grant us pardon, and remove evil from grieving souls, Almighty God Who knows man’s thoughts; I cry to You in affliction and weariness, redeem my soul from destruction and the pit, draw near to my soul and redeem it.}
\hebeng{טוֹב מִבֶּטֶן גֹּחִי. יוֹצְרִי וְשִׂבְרִי וּמִבְטָחִי. בְּיָדְךָ אַפְקִיד רוּחִי: כְּבֹשׁ־כַּעַסְךָ מִידִידֶיךָ. לִרְאוֹת־שַׁחַת אַל־תִּתֵּן חֲסִידֶיךָ. עֲנֵנִי יְהֹוָה כִּי־טוֹב חַסְדֶּךָ:\par }{Beneficent One, Who drew me from the womb, my Creator, my hope and my trust, in Your hand I entrust my spirit; withhold Your anger from Your beloved ones, cause not Your devoted ones to see the pit, answer me Adonoy, for Your kindness is good.}
\hebeng{מַכָּה בְּלִי־תְרוּפָה. נֶצַח לְחוֹרְפֶיךָ תִּשְׁלַח בְּהַקְצָפָה. וּבְעַמְּךָ לֹא לְמַגֵּפָה: סֻגַּפְנוּ בְּיוֹם זֶה. עֱנוּתֵנוּ לֹא־תְשַׁקֵּץ וְלֹא־תִבְזֶה. סְלַח־נָא לַעֲוֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה:\par }{With an incurable, eternal blow, strike with anger those who blaspheme You, but do not plague Your people; we afflict ourselves this day, do not abhor nor despise our cry, pardon the iniquity of this people.}
\hebeng{פָּשַׁעְנוּ וּמָעָלְנוּ. צוּר לְךָ חָבוֹל חָבָלְנוּ. לָכֵן כִּלִּינוּ בְאַפְּךָ, וּבַחֲמָתְךָ נִבְהָלְנוּ: קָדוֹשׁ, רִיב אַל־תִּמְתַּח. רְאֵה כִּי־כַפַּי לְךָ אֶשְׁטַח. יוֹם אִירָא אֲנִי אֵלֶיךָ אֶבְטָח:\par }{We have transgressed and dealt treacherously, O Rock, we have been corrupt towards You. Therefore, we are consumed by Your anger and we are terrified by Your rage; Holy One! do not extend contention, behold, my hands are stretched out to You, on the day when I am afraid, I will put my trust in You.}
\hebeng{שֶׁפֶךְ שִֹיחַ עַמֶּךָ. תָּחֹן וְתַעַן שְׁלֵמֶיךָ. אַל־תִּנְאַץ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ: שְׁעֵה שַׁוְעַת אֲנוּנִים. לְקוֹרְאֶיךָ מִדֹּחַק הַסְכֵּת מִמְּעוֹנִים. שׁוֹמֵעַ אֶל אֶבְיוֹנִים:\par }{Your people pour out their prayer, be merciful and answer Your faithful ones, do not abhor us for Your Name’s sake, turn to the cry of the suffering, to those who call You out of distress, hear them from the high heavens, You Who listens to the needy.}
\hebeng{נְדִיבֵי עַם מַטַּע נַעֲמָנִים. הַחוֹסֶיךָ קֹוֶיךָ טְהוֹרֶיךָ נִמְנִים. מַהֵר תְּרַחֲמֵם, כְּרַחֵם אָב עַל־בָּנִים:\par }{{[Israel]} the noblest among people, the pleasant offspring, they trust in You, they hope to You, they are counted among Your pure ones, quickly have mercy on them as a father has mercy on his children.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{אַל־יָשֹׁב דַּךְ נִכְלָם עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן יְהַלְלוּ שְׁמֶךָ׃ אַל־תִּרְחַק מִמֶּנּוּ כִּי־צָרָה קְרוֹבָה כִּי־אֵין עוֹזֵר׃ כִּי אֶסְלַח לַעֲוֺנָם וּלְחַטָּאתָם לֹא אֶזְכָּר־עוֹד׃ וְסָלַחְתָּ לְעַמְּךָ אֲשֶׁר חָטְאוּ־לָךְ וּלְכָל־פִּשְׁעֵיהֶם אֲשֶׁר פָּשְׁעוּ־בָךְ, וּנְתַתָּם לְרַחֲמִים לִפְנֵי שֹׁבֵיהֶם׃ וְאַתָּה אֱלוֹהַּ סְלִיחוֹת חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם אֶרֶךְ־אַפַּיִם וְרַב־חֶסֶד וְלֹא עֲזַבְתָּם׃\par }{Let the oppressed not be put to shame, let the poor and needy praise Your Name. Be not far {[removed]} from us, for distress is near, and there is no one to help. For I will pardon their iniquity, and their sin I will no longer mention. Pardon Your people that have sinned before You, and all their transgressions that they have transgressed unto You, and grant mercy before their captors. And You, God that pardons, Gracious, Merciful, Slow to anger, and Abounding in kindness— do not forsake them.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לז. {\small מיוסד על פי א״ב. חתום שלמה הבבלי.} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon HaBavli.}} }
\hebeng{אָב לְרַחֵם וְרַב סְלֹחַ חוֹלַלְתָּנוּ. בְּנֵי בְרִית קֹדֶשׁ וְלֹא חִלַּלְתָּנוּ. גּוֹלִים וְאַתָּה בְּקִרְבֵּנוּ כַּאֲשֶׁר יִחַלְתָּנוּ. וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲוֹנֵנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּנוּ:\par }{{[Our]} Father, You created us with compassion and pardon, \textit{When God created man, He knew that man required His mercy and forgiveness.} we are the children of Your holy covenant, and You have never exchanged us; \textit{For any other nation.} even in our exile, You are with us, as You have given us hope. \textit{By promising not to leave us even in the worst of times.} And {[now]} pardon our iniquity and our sin and take us for Your inheritance.}
\hebeng{דָּם וְגִאוּל תָּדִיחַ, דִּין תָּאִיר. הַחֵטְא יָעֳלַם וּבַל יִמָּצֵא לְהַכְעִיר. וְעָוֹן יְבֻקַּשׁ וְאֵינֶנּוּ כְּנַמְתָּ לְהַבְאִיר. כִּי אֶסְלַח לַאֲשֶׁר אַשְׁאִיר:\par }{Wash away the blood and filth \textit{Of our sins.} bring our judgment into light; let our sin be hidden and not be found to make us repulsive and let our iniquity be sought and none be found, As You clearly stated: “I will forgive those that I will spare.”}
\hebeng{זַהַם מְרֻבָּה וּפָסַק נִיחוֹחַ מְמֻלָּח. חֲצִיצַת חֲפִיפַת לִכְלוּךְ שֶׁרֶץ הַלָּח. טְבִילַת טָהֳרַת צִנּוֹר מֵימֶיךָ יְקַלָּח. כִּי אַתָּה יְהֹוָה טוֹב וְסַלָּח:\par }{The foulness {[of our sins]} is great and the aroma of our sacrifices \textit{“\textup{ניחוח ממלח}“ lit. the salted pleasant odor—all sacrifices were salted before being burnt on the altar as a pleasant fragrance to God. (v. Vayikra 2, 13)} has ceased. \textit{Since the destruction of the Temple.} The covering of soil {[caused by]} the filth of the moist creeping thing, \textit{A ritually unclean person who has any foreign matter covering any part of his body cannot become ritually clean unless he first removes the impurity.} let that become cleansed by immersion in the flow of Your waters, for You are Adonoy, good and forgiving.}
\hebeng{יַעַן סָרַחְנוּ נִדַּחְנוּ וּמִשְׁמַן רָזֶה. כִּי רַבָּה הַטֻּמְאָה וְאֵין מַזֶּה. לְמַעַנְךָ יְהֹוָה כְּאָז וְלְפָנִים מִזֶּה. סְלַח נָא לַעֲוֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה:\par }{Since we sinned we were exiled and from corpulence {[we became]} emaciated for the impurity is abundant and there is none {[priest]} to sprinkle us. \textit{With the mixture of water and ashes from the red heifer—the procedure used in purifying one who was contaminated with the ritual uncleanness of a dead body.} For Your sake, Adonoy, as {[You did]} then and before this, forgive, please, the sins of this nation.}
\hebeng{מִסַּפֵּר עָצְמוּ חַסְדֵי רֹב גְּמוּלֶיךָ. נִהַגְתָּ לְעַם בֵּית מֶרִי לְמוּלֶךָ. סִבְלָם נָא תִשָּׂא כְּמִקֶּדֶם נְטוּלֶיךָ. וְסָלַחְתָּ לְעַמְּךָ אֲשֶׁר חָטְאוּ לְךָ:\par }{They are too abundant to relate— the great goodness that You have bestowed. You led the nation {[even]} when it was rebellious towards You. Please, carry their burden as You carried it in previous days, and forgive Your nation that has sinned to You.}
\hebeng{עָלֵינוּ מִמָּרוֹם רוּחַ קָדְשׁוֹ יֵעָרֶה. פָּרוֹשׁ וְהִתְקַדֵּשׁ וְחָדָשׁ לָנוּ יִבָּרֵא. צֵרוֹף וּמֵרוֹק בְּלִי יִסּוּרִין תּוֹרֶה. כִּי עִמְּךָ הַסְּלִיחָה לְמַעַן תִּוָּרֵא:\par }{Upon us, from on high let His holy spirit pour forth, so that we may separate ourselves {[from sin]}, and sanctify {[us]} and {[a]} new {[heart]} create for us. The purification and the cleansing {[from sin]}— order that they be without suffering, for forgiveness is with You \textit{It is in Your hands to forgive.} so that You shall be feared.}
\hebeng{קוֹמֵם נְפוּלָה עוֹד מִלְּהוֹסִיף דַּאֲבוֹנֵנוּ. רוּחַ חֵן רַוֵּה שַׂבַּע רַעֲבוֹנֵנוּ. שָׁלְמוּ תַּמוּ עֵת רִעוּעַ בּוֹנֵנוּ. לְמַעַן שִׁמְךָ יְהֹוָה וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲווֹנֵנוּ:\par }{Stand upright the fallen one. \textit{“Fallen one”—the Jewish nation.} {[Refrain]} from adding to our misfortune. {[With]} a spirit of kindness satiate our hunger. Annihilation has come {[to those who]} rebuilt us at the time we were weakened. \textit{“To those … rebuilt us” i.e. the righteous of every generation.} For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy, forgive our sins.}
\hebeng{שִׁירַיִם הִנֵּנוּ וּמִי כָמוֹךָ נוֹשֵׂא. לֹא עַל צִדְקוֹתֵינוּ אוֹת נְנַסֶּה. מִדַּת הֲמוֹן רַחֲמֶיךָ נַפִּיל מַחֲסֶה. אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָעָה אֲדֹנָי סְלָחָה אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה:\par }{We have become as leftovers \textit{“Leftovers”—the remains at the bottom of the pot.} and who, like You, can forgive {[such as these]}. Not {[based]} upon our righteousness will we attempt to seek a sign, \textit{“A sign”—that You have forgiven us.} but upon your virtue of abundant compassion we will send \textit{\textup{נפיל}—lit. “throw.”} our plea. Adonoy, listen! Adonoy, forgive! Adonoy, pay attention {[to us]} and do!}
\hebeng{בְּיִרְאָתְךָ וּבְתוֹרָתְךָ הָכֵן פְּעָמֵינוּ לִצְעֹד. בְּיַד עֲוֹנֵינוּ כִּי כָשַׁלְנוּ לִמְעֹד. נָא־יֵאָמֵן דְּבָרְךָ הַטּוֹב לִסְעֹד. כִּי אֶסְלַח לַעֲווֹנָם. וּלְחַטָּאתָם לֹא אֶזְכַּר־עוֹד:\par }{In Your fear and in Your righteous Torah, establish our footsteps to tread, for through our sins we have become too weak to take a step. Please fulfill Your good promise to support {[us]}: “For I shall forgive their iniquities, and their sins I will no longer remember.”}
\hebeng{יוֹדֵעַ תַּעֲלוּם כָּל דָּם וּלְחוּם חַטֹּאתֵינוּ יְדַעֲנוּם וְאִתָּנוּ בְּכָל תְּחוּם. הִנְנוּ אָתָאנוּ־לָךְ מְצֹא כֹפֶר וְתַנְחוּם. וְאַתָּה אֱלוֹהַּ סְלִיחוֹת חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם:\par }{You know the hidden of every blood and flesh. \textit{Blood and flesh, i.e. human.} {[We committed]} iniquities {[despite]} that we knew them and they are with us everywhere. \textit{And—everywhere, i.e. we cannot escape our sins.} We, hereby, come before You {[that we may find redemption and consolation, for You are the forgiving God gracious and compassionate.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{לָמָה יְהוָה תַּעֲמֹד בְּרָחוֹק תַּעְלִים לְעִתּוֹת בַּצָּרָה׃ שׁוּב לְמַעַן עֲבָדֶיךָ שִׁבְטֵי נַחֲלָתֶךָ׃ תִּתֵּן אֱמֶת לְיַעֲקֹב חֶסֶד לְאַבְרָהָם אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּעְתָּ לַאֲבֹתֵינוּ מִימֵי קֶדֶם׃\par }{Why do You stand from afar, Adonoy, hiding Yourself in times of trouble? Return for the sake of Your servants the tribes of Your inheritance. You will grant truth to Jacob, kindliness to Abraham. As You have sworn to our fathers from the days of old.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{לח. {\small מיוסד על פי א״ב. חתום שלמה בן מנחם חזק.} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon ben Menachem.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְֹרֵה מִדּוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּחֲנִינָה.} נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, אֲחַלֶּה פְּנֵי־מַלְכִּי בִּתְחִנָּה. לְחַפֵּשֹ זְכוּת כְּנוּיִים קְרוּאִים שׁוֹשַׁנָּה. מַלְּטֵם מִכָּל־רָעוֹת בְּזֹאת הַשָּׁנָה:\par }{Thirteen Divine attributes which were pronounced with compassion; by virtue of every fitting attribute, I beseech the Presence of my King with supplication, to search for the merit {[of Israel]} who were named and called the Rose. Save them from all evil in this year.}
\hebeng{אִם אַשְׁמָתָם גָּדְלָה עַד־שְׁמֵי־רוּם וְכוֹכְבֵיהֶם. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, אֲבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עֲלֵיהֶם. לְבַטֵּל מֵהֶם כָּתוּב, אָמַרְתִּי אַפְאֵיהֶם. לָמָּה יֹאמְרוּ הַגּוֹיִם, אַיֵּה־נָא אֱלֹהֵיהֶם:\par }{If their guilt be so great as to reach the heavens and their stars, {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute, I plead for mercy for them, to annul for them what is written: \textit{Deut. 32:26.} “I said I will scatter them etc.” Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” \textit{Psalms 115:2.}}
\hebeng{אִם־גָּבְרוּ עֲוֹנוֹת וְעָצְמוּ מִלְּסַפְּרָה. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, דְּחֵה אוֹתָם יְהֹוָה לְהַסְתִּירָה. דִבּוּבֵי־עֹז בְּתַחַן, לְבַטֵּל מֵהֶם כָּתוּב, אַסְתִּירָה. לָמָה יְהֹוָה תַּעֲמֹד בְּרָחוֹק, תַּעְלִים לְעִתּוֹת בַּצָּרָה:\par }{If their iniquities are grievous and too many to count, {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute cast them away, Adonoy, and conceal them; let our vigorous words of supplication annul that which is written: “I will hide {[my face from them]}.” \textit{Deut. 32:20.} Why, Adonoy, do You stand far off, hiding Yourself in times of trouble? \textit{Psalms 10:1.}}
\hebeng{אִם הֶעֱווּ פְּנֵי מַלְכָּם בְּעַזּוּת־פָּנִים וּמֵצַח. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, אֶתְחַנֶּן־לוֹ בְּפֶצַח. וְנַפְשִׁי שִׁפְכִי כַמַּיִם לִבֵּךְ, נֹכַח אָדֹם וָצַח. לָמָה אֱלֹהִים זָנַחְתָּ לָנֶצַח:\par }{If they have acted perversely in the Presence of their King, with a brazen face; {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute, I offer supplication with a loud voice, {[and say to]} my soul: “Pour out your heart as water” \textit{Lamentations 2:19.} in the presence of Him “Who is pure white and ruddy.” \textit{Song of Songs 5:10.} “Why, God, have You cast us off forever.” \textit{Psalms 74:1.}}
\hebeng{אִם־זְדוֹנוֹת הִשִּׁיאוּ לֵב־טִפֵּשׁ וְנִשְׁחַץ. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, חַלֵּץ אוֹתָם יְהֹוָה מִמַּחַץ. חוּשׁ וּבֹא וְשָֹא קוֹל־נַחַץ. לָמָּה־קֹדֵר אֶתְהַלֵּךְ בְּלַחַץ:\par }{If willful sins have misled the foolish and haughty heart; {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute, save them, Adonoy, from crushing wounds, hasten and come, and lift up the strong voice {[of redemption]} “Why do I go mourning under oppression.” \textit{Psalms 42:10.}}
\hebeng{אִם־טָפְלוּ שֶׁקֶר בְּהֶגֶה וְהַוּוֹת לְעֻמֶךָ. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, יְדִידוּת תִּזְכֹּר מִמַּנְעִימֶיךָ. יִתְגּוֹלְלוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ עַל־שְׁאֵרִית עַמֶּךָ. לָמָה יְהֹוָה יֶחֱרֶה אַפְּךָ בְּעַמֶּךָ:\par }{If they have slandered in words and thoughts against You, {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute, remember the love of those who praise You and let Your compassion be moved towards the remnant of Your people. “Why should Your anger burn against Your people.” \textit{Exodus 32:11.}}
\hebeng{אִם־כָּבְדוּ אֹזֶן, לְסַלֵּף מִנִּי הַדֶּרֶךְ. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, אֲלַחֵשׁ עַל־עַמִּי בְּעֶרֶךְ. וְנַפְשִׁי שִׁפְכִי לִבֵּךְ, פְּנֵי קוֹנֵךְ וְצוּרֵךְ. לָמָּה פָּרַצְתָּ גְדֵרֶיהָ, וְאָרוּהָ כָּל עֹבְרֵי דָרֶךְ:\par }{If they harden their ear {[from hearing]} and pervert their way, {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute, I offer silent prayer for my people, and my soul—pour out your heart in the Presence of your Possessor and Rock. “Why have You broken down her fences, so that all wayfarers pluck her fruit.” \textit{Psalms 80:13.}}
\hebeng{אִם־מָרְדוּ בְרֹב־פִּשְׁעָם, לְצוּר מַלְכִּי וּקְדוֹשִׁי. נָא כָּל־מִדָּה נְכוֹנָה, נַפְשִׁי נֹעַם עֲלֵיהֶם תְּבַקְּשִׁי. לְנוֹרָא מָרוֹם וְקָדוֹשׁ. בְּעֶתֶר אֵלָיו תִּדְרְשִׁי. לָמָה יְהֹוָה תִּזְנַח מִשָּׁלוֹם נַפְשִׁי:\par }{If they have rebelled with great transgression against the Rock, my King, my Holy One; {[then]} by virtue of every fitting attribute, my soul—seek pleasantness for them; before the Awesome, Most High, and Holy One, address prayerful supplication. Why, Adonoy, do You cast off my soul? \textit{Psalms 88:15.}}
