\hebeng{אֶת־יְהֹוָה בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ לְדָרְשׁוֹ קִדַּמְתִּי. בְּעַד עֲוֹנוֹת לְכַפֵּר, כִּי כַתּוֹלָע נֶאֱדַמְתִּי. גֻּלְגַּל־הַלֵּב וְטוּמְטַם וּכְיָשֵׁן נִרְדַּמְתִּי. כִּמְעַט כִסְדוֹם הָיִיתִי וְלַעֲמוֹרָה דָּמִיתִי:\par }{While Adonoy may be found, \textit{Especially during the Ten Days of Penitence.} I rise early to seek Him; to entreat Him to atone {[my]} iniquities, for I am red {[with sin]} as scarlet. My heart is confused and benumbed, and as one asleep, I drowse. I have become almost like Sodom, and to Gomorrah am I likened.}
\hebeng{דָּמִיתִי לְסוֹטָה פְרוּעָה מְנָאֶפֶת וַחֲלָלָה. הָיִיתִי כְבֶגֶד־עִדִּים, וְהוּשַֹמְתִּי כְּשִֹמְלָה בְדָמִים מְגוֹלְלָה. וְחָסַרְתִּי מַפְגִּיעַ, וְיוֹדֵעַ אַיִן לְפַלְּלָה. רְאֵה יְהֹוָה וְהַבִּיטָה, כִּי־הָיִיתִי זוֹלֵלָה:\par }{I resemble a faithless wife, and a shameless adultress; I have become like a polluted garment, like a garment stained with blood. I lack a mediator, and one that knows how to pray {[for me]}. Look Adonoy! and see, for I have become repulsive. \textit{Lamentations 1:11.}}
\hebeng{זוֹלֵלָה כְּבוּדָה נֶהֱפְכָה בְּיַד־מְגָאֵל. חִנָּם נִמְכְּרָה לִצְמִיתוּת, וְאֵין־גּוֹאֵל. טֻבַּע נָכוֹן וְנִשָּׂא וְחָרֵב אֲרִיאֵל. הִשְׁלִיךְ מִשָּׁמַיִם אֶרֶץ תִּפְאֶרֶת־יִשְֹרָאֵל:\par }{{[Israel]} the honored one has become repulsive in the hands of those who besmirch her; she has been sold for naught forever, and there is none to redeem her. That which was firm and upraised \textit{The Holy Temple.} has sunken and the Ariel {[the Altar]} has been destroyed; cast down from heaven to the earth, is the glory of Israel. \textit{Lamentations 2:1.}}
\hebeng{יִשְֹרָאֵל לְבוֹזְזִים וְלִמְשִׁסָּה, עַד־מָתַי. כָּאַרְבֶּה רַבּוּ עוֹרְקַי, וְעָצְמוּ מַצְמִיתַי. לַלֵּב בְּשֹוּמִי, הֲרִיסוֹתַי חָרְבוֹתַי וְשׁוֹמְמוֹתַי. וַתִּבְחַר מַחֲנַק נַפְשִׁי, מָוֶת מֵעַצְמוֹתָי:\par }{Israel is a prey to robbers and vandals— how long will this continue? Numerous as locusts are my pursuers and mighty are my destroyers; when I take to heart, my ruin, my destruction and my devastation, my soul prefers {[to die from]} strangulation, and death rather than to dwell in my bones. \textit{My soul prefers death rather than dwell within me.}}
\hebeng{מֵעַצְמוֹתַי הַמְפֻצָּחוֹת וְהַמְפֻלָּחוֹת, מִמַּכְעִיסֶךָ וּמִמַּזְעִימֶךָ. נָאַמְתִּי, נִלְאֵיתִי נְשֹא חֲרוֹנְךָ וְזַעֲמֶךָ. שִֹים לֵב לִגְאֹל חַיַּת נְעִימֶיךָ. כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא, עַל־עִירְךָ וְעַל־עַמֶּךָ:\par }{Because my bones are crushed and pierced by those who provoke and blaspheme You, I said, “I cannot bear Your anger and Your wrath.” May it be in Your heart to redeem the life of Your beloved ones, for Your Name is called on Your city and on Your people.}
\hebeng{עַמְּךָ זְרוּיִים פְּזוּרִים בְּכָל־מוֹשָׁבוֹת. פְּקָדוּךָ בַּצָּר, פְּחָדוּךָ בְּמַעַשֹ וּבְמַחֲשָׁבוֹת. צְלֹל־זָדוֹן, וְהַעֲבֵר וְרַפֵּא מְשׁוּבוֹת. אֲדֹנָי, שִׁמְעָה בְקוֹלֵנוּ, תִּהְיֶינָה אָזְנֶיךָ קַשֻּׁבוֹת:\par }{Your people, scattered and dispersed among every nation, remember You in their adversity and fear You in deed and thought. Drown their deliberate sins, and forgive and heal their negligence. My Master, hear our voice, let Your ears be attentive {[to our prayer]}.}
\hebeng{קַשֻּׁבוֹת תִּהְיֶינָה אָזְנֶיךָ, לְשֶׁפֶךְ שִֹיחֵנוּ. רֹן־שְׂפָתֵינוּ קַבֵּל כְּרֵיחַ נִיחֹחֵינוּ. שִׁחַרְנוּךָ מָגִנֵּנוּ וּבְךָ יַהַב מִבְטָחֵנוּ. כִּי שִׁמְךָ עָלֵינוּ נִקְרָא אַל־תַּנִּיחֵנוּ:\par }{Let Your ears be attentive to the outpouring of our pleading, let the praise of our lips be acceptable as the sweet savor of our sacrifices. We seek You, our Shield, and in You we place our trust, for we are called by Your Name, do not abandon us.}
\hebeng{תַּנִּיחֵנוּ אָדוֹן זֶה כַּמֶּה־שָׁנִים לָמָּה. לְשַׁמָּה לְמָשָׁל וְלִשְׁנִינָה לְלַעַג לְבוֹשֶׁת וְלִכְלִמָּה. יֵאָמֵן וְיוּחַשׁ הַמִּבְטָח, שֶׁהִבְטַחְתָּ לַשּׁוֹמֵמָה. אֲנִי יְהֹוָה בָּנִיתִי הַנֶּהֱרָסוֹת, נָטַעְתִּי הַנְּשַׁמָּה:\par }{You have abandoned us, O Master, these many years—why? We have become as astonishment, an example, a byword, a scorn, a shame and disgrace. \textit{Among the nations of the world who persecute us.} Speedily fulfill the promise that You made to the desolate {[land]}: “I, Adonoy, build the ruins, and plant that which was desolate.” \textit{Ezekiel 36:36.}}
\hebeng{הַנְּשַׁמָּה בְּרַחֲמִים גְּדוֹלִים תִּבְנֶה וּתְכוֹנְנָהּ. שְׁמַע יָהּ חִנּוּנָהּ, כִּי־בָא עֵת לְחֶנְנָהּ. חַזֵּק מַאֲמִירֶךָ, בְּצֵל־יָדְךָ לְגוֹנְנָהּ. וּפְדוּיֵי יְהֹוָה יְשׁוּבוּן, וּבָאוּ צִיּוֹן בְּרִנָּה:\par }{The desolate land, in Your great mercy, rebuild it, and establish it firmly; hear, O God, her supplication, for the time to favor her is come. Strengthen those who praise You, shield them in the shadow of Your hand, and may the redeemed ones of Adonoy, return and come to Zion with singing.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:}{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.” }
\hebeng{דִּרְשׁוּ יְהוָה וְעֻזּוֹ בַּקְּשׁוּ פָנָיו תָּמִיד׃ דִּרְשׁוּ יְהוָה בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ, קְרָאֻהוּ בִּהְיוֹתוֹ קָרוֹב׃ יַעֲזֹב רָשָׁע דַּרְכּוֹ וְאִישׁ אָוֶן מַחְשְׁבֹתָיו וְיָשֹׁב אֶל־יְהוָה וִירַחֲמֵהוּ וְאֶל־אֱלֹהֵינוּ כִּי־יַרְבֶּה לִסְלוֹחַ׃ שׁוּבָה יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ כִּי כָשַׁלְתָּ בַּעֲוֺנֶךָ׃\par }{Seek Adonoy and His might, seek His Presence continually. Seek Adonoy while He may be found call upon Him while He is near. Let the wicked one forsake his way, and the man of deceit, his thoughts; and let him return to Adonoy, and He will have compassion for him, and to our God, for He will abundantly pardon. Return Israel unto God, for you have failed by your iniquity.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{מח. {\small ע״פ א״ב. חיבר רב סעדיה גאון} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rav Saadyah Gaon.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{אָבְלָה נַפְשִׁי} וְחָשַׁךְ תָּאֳרִי. בֵּית תִּפְאַרְתִּי כְּנָשַׁף בּוֹ הָאֲרִי. גַּם פְּלֵיטָתִי אֲשֶׁר־עָזְבוּ וּשְׁאֵרִי. דֹּעֲכוּ כְּהַיּוֹם בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בְּתִשְׁרִי:\par }{My soul mourns and my face is darkened, {[because]} the House of my glory \textit{The Holy Temple.} has been smashed by the lion; \textit{Nevuchadnetsar.} even my escaped ones that were left, my remnant, were crushed on the third day of Tishri.}
\hebeng{הָאֵשׁ וְהַמַּיִם הַזֵּידוֹנִים שְׁטָפוּנוּ בְּדָלְקָם. וּבָסְסוּ מִקְדָּשׁ וּבָזְזוּ חֶלְקָם. זִקְנֵי שְׁאֵרִית אֲשֶׁר פָּלְטוּ מִיּוֹם־נָקָם. חֻבָּלוּ עַתָּה בְּיוֹם צוֹם גְּדַלְיָה בֶּן־אֲחִיקָם:\par }{The raging flames and flood overwhelmed us in their pursuit; they trod down the Temple and divided the spoil; the elders of the remnant who escaped the day of vengeance, were now destroyed on the fast day of Gedaliah ben Achikam.}
\hebeng{טֹרָפוּ דַלַּת עַם הָאָרֶץ. יֶתֶר הַגָּזָם אָכַל הָאַרְבֶּה בְּמֶרֶץ. כּוֹרְמִים וְיוֹגְבִים פְּקֻדַּת מַרְגִּיז הָאָרֶץ. לֹהֲטוּ וְלֹא־הָיָה בָם גּוֹדֵר גָּדֶר וְעוֹמֵד בַּפֶּרֶץ:\par }{The poor among the people were torn apart, that which was left by the caterpillar, \textit{Nevuchadnetsar.} was quickly devoured by the locust; \textit{Ishmael ben Netanya.} the vine-keepers and farmers that were left on the orders of Nevuchadnetsar, \textit{Lit. “the earth shakers.” See Jeremiah 52:16.} perished in the flames, and there was none left to erect a fence and to stand in the breach.}
\hebeng{מָה אֲסַפֵּר וְאַנְחוֹתַי עֲצוּמוֹת. נָקְטָה נַפְשִׁי וּמַקְהֵלוֹתַי עֲגוּמוֹת. שְֹרִיגֵנוּ אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁאֲרוּ מִיקוֹד־אֵשׁ לְתַעֲצוּמוֹת. עוֹד הֵם לֹא־נִתְקַיְּמוּ וְנִתָּשׁוּ בְּחֵמוֹת:\par }{How can I narrate {[the disaster]} when my groaning is so heavy? My soul is weary, and my congregations are grieved. The few vines {[Jews]} that remained, from the fierce burning, even they could not remain, and were scattered in wrath.}
\hebeng{פָּנֶיךָ עַד־מָתַי מִמֶּנּוּ תַּסְתִּיר. צַעֲקָתֵינוּ שְׁמַע וַאֲסִירֵינוּ תַּתִּיר. קָדוֹשׁ בִּיטָה כִּי־אֵין בַּעֲדֵנוּ מַעְתִּיר. רְאֵה בְּדַלּוּתֵנוּ וְשִׁבְחֲךָ בְּפֶה נַכְתִּיר:\par }{How long will You hide your face from us? Hear our cry and loosen our bound ones, O Holy One, behold, there is no one to plead in our behalf, look on our misery {[and redeem us]}, and we will crown You with Your praise.}
\hebeng{שֻׁדַדְנוּ מִדּוֹר לְדוֹר וּמִקֵּץ לְקֵץ. שֹׁרֶשׁ צֶפַע מְעוֹפֵף אוֹתָנוּ עוֹקֵץ. תַּקִּיף, לְמִשְׁפָּטֵנוּ הָעֵר וְהָקֵץ. תְּכַפֵּר לַעֲוֹנוֹתֵינוּ וְנֹאמַר קֵץ:\par }{We have been despoiled from generation to generation, and from age to age, the fangs of the flying viper stings us; Mighty One, be aroused and awake for our justification, Atone our iniquities, and call an end {[to our suffering]}.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{דִּרְשׁוּ יְהוָה בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ, קְרָאֻהוּ בִּהְיוֹתוֹ קָרוֹב׃ שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים אֶרְפָּה מְשׁוּבֹתֵיכֶם הִנְנוּ אָתָנוּ לָךְ כִּי אַתָּה יְהֹוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ׃ שׁוּבָה יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ כִּי כָשַׁלְתָּ בַּעֲוֺנֶךָ׃\par }{Seek Adonoy while He may be found call upon while He is near. Return, irreverent children, I will heal your irreverence. Behold we approach You for You are Adonoy, our God. Return, Israel to Adonoy, Your God, for you have failed by your iniquity.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{מט. {\small מיוסד על פי א״ב. חתום בנימין.} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Benjamin ben Zorach.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{אִמַּנְתָּ מֵאָז} אֲרֶשֶׁת נִיב שְֹפָתַיִם. בִּתְפִלָּה ובְתַחֲנוּן דְּפֹק שַׁעֲרֵי־דְלָתָיִם. גִּשְׁתֵּנוּ עָדֶיךָ בִּזְרִיזוּת וְלֹא־בַעֲצַלְתַּיִם. דְּחוֹת רֹעַ־פּוּרְעָנֻיּוֹת הַמִּתְרַגְּשׁוֹת לְעִתּוֹתָיִם:\par }{You taught us of old, to entreat You with our lips; {[how]} with prayer and supplication to knock at {[Your]} door. We approach You with diligence and not with laziness— avert calamities {[from us]} that come from time to time.}
\hebeng{הִנְנוּ אָתָאנוּ לְךָ בְּשִׁבְרוֹן רוּחַ וְדִכְּאוּת לֵב. וַדּוֹת לְפָנֶיךָ כָּל־פִּתּוּל וְעִקְשׁוּת־לֵב. זֶה חוֹקֵר לְבָבוֹת, הָרוֹפֵא לִשְׁבוּרֵי־לֵב. חַדֵּשׁ רוּחַ נָכוֹן בְּקִרְבֵּנוּ, וּבְרָא־לָנוּ טְהוֹר־לֵב:\par }{Behold we come before You with broken spirit and humbled heart, to confess before You all our follies and stubborness of heart; You Who searches hearts, and heals the broken in spirit, renew a correct spirit within us, and create for us a pure heart.}
\hebeng{טִכַּסְתָּ מִקֶּדֶם אֵלּוּ יָמִים עֲשָֹרָה. יָחִיד בָּם לָשׁוּב וְלִמְצֹא כַפָּרָה. כָּל־הַשָּׁנָה כֻּלָּהּ לָרַבִּים מְסוּרָה. לְשַׁוֵּעַ וְלַעֲנוֹת בְּכָל־עֵת צוּקָה וְצָרָה:\par }{You appointed from of old these ten days, for each individual to return and find atonement, while the entire year is available for communal repentance, to cry and pray in times of anguish and distress.}
\hebeng{מִהֵר הַיָּחִיד וְשָׁב בֵּנְתַּיִם, מוֹחְלִין־לוֹ. נוֹאָשׁ וְלֹא־שָׁב, אֵין תַּקָּנָה לְעִוּוּלוֹ. סִדֵּר וְעָרַךְ כָּל־אֵילֵי־נְבָיוֹת לְהוֹעִילוֹ. עוֹתֵר וְצוֹעֵק וְאֵין־שׁוֹמֵעַ־לוֹ:\par }{If the individual hastens and repents within {[these ten days]}, he is pardoned; but if he despairs {[of atonement]} and does not repent, there is no hope for his iniquity. Even if he prepares and offers all the rams of Nevayos \textit{A place of the choicest rams.} to help him, though he will plead and cry his prayer will not be heard.}
\hebeng{פְּגִיעַת־הָרַבִּים וְהַיָּחִיד לְךָ־לְבַד עוֹלָה. צוּר, כִּי אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה. קַבְּלֵנוּ בְרָצוֹן וְהַמְצִיאֵנוּ מְחִילָה. רְצֵנוּ כְקָרְבַּן כָּלִיל וְעוֹלָה:\par }{The prayers of the congregation as well as those of the individual, ascend to You alone; for You, our Rock, hear prayer; receive us with favor and grant us pardon, favor us as though we had brought burnt-offerings.}
\hebeng{שָׁפוֹט תִּשְׁפֹּט אוֹתָנוּ בְּרַחֲמִים וְחֶמְלָה. בָּנֶיךָ יְחוּסֶיךָ לְקוּחִים־לְךָ לִסְגֻלָּה. יֹקֶשׁ־מֶרְיָם יוּצְלַל בִּמְצוּלָה. נֶצַח לְהַלֶּלְךָ בְּכָל־מִינֵי תְהִלָּה:\par }{Judge us with compassion and pity— Your distinguished children whom You took for Your treasure— let their disobedience be drowned in the depths of the sea, and let them praise You forever with every kind of praise.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:}{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{אַל תִּזְכָּר לָֽנוּ עֲוֹנוֹת רִאשׁוֹנִים מַהֵר יְקַדְּמֽוּנוּ רַחֲמֶֽיךָ כִּי דַלּֽוֹנוּ מְאֹד: כִּי־שֹׁמֵעַ אֶל־אֶבְיוֹנִים יְהוָה וְאֶת־אֲסִירָיו לֹא בָזָה׃ כִּי כָלוּ בְיָגוֹן חַיֵּינוּ וּשְׁנוֹתֵינוּ בַּאֲנָחָה: כִּי־עָלֶיךָ הֹרַגְנוּ כָל־הַיּוֹם נֶחְשַׁבְנוּ כְּצֹאן טִבְחָה׃ כִּי לֹא יִזְנַח לְעוֹלָם אֲדֹנָי:\par }{Remember not the sins of our ancestors, let Your mercy come swiftly toward us, for we have been brought very low. For Adonoy hears the {[cry]} of the needy, and His bound ones, He does not shame. For our lives are spent in sorrow, and our years in sighing. For because of {[our faith in]} You we are murdered each day; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered. For You will not forsake us forever, O God.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{נ. {\small חיבר רבנו שמעון בר יצחק הגדול} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rav Shimon ben Isaac {[R’ Shimon the Great]}.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{אוֹרְךָ וַאֲמִתְּךָ שְׁלַח.} אֱמוּנֶיךָ בְּטוֹב הַצְלַח. כִּי אַתָּה יְהֹוָה טוֹב וְסַלָּח: בִּיטָה בְעִנּוּי־נֶפֶשׁ. בְּטוּבְךָ הוֹצִיאֵנוּ לַחֹפֶשׁ. כִּי־בָאוּ מַיִם עַד־נָפֶשׁ:\par }{Send us Your light and Your truth, grant good fortune to those who believe in You, for You Adonoy are good and forgiving. Look on our afflicted souls, in Your goodness, take us to freedom, for the waters have reached our souls.}
\hebeng{גַּעֲיוֹתֵינוּ יְהוּ נִקְשָׁבִים. גָּלוּתֵנוּ הָשֵׁב לְיִשּׁוּבִים. כִּי־גֵּרִים אֲנַחְנוּ וְתוֹשָׁבִים: דָּפַקְנוּ דְּלָתֶיךָ לִתְמֹד. דָּבַקְנוּ אֵלֶיךָ לִצְמֹד. כִּי דַּלּוֹנוּ מְאֹד:\par }{May our cries be heard, return our exiles to their dwellings, for we are strangers and sojourners. We knock at Your door constantly, we cling to You, to be joined, for we have been brought very low.}
\hebeng{הֱלִיצוּנוּ זֵדִים בִּמְצָרֵינוּ. הַצִּילֵנוּ וְנוֹדְךָ צוּרֵנוּ. כִּי־הוֹשַׁעְתָּנוּ מִצָּרֵינוּ: זְרוּיֶיךָ מְיַחֲלִים לְעוֹדְדָם. זַכִּים בְּיִרְאָתְךָ לְסַעֲדָם. כִּי־זֶה כָּל־הָאָדָם:\par }{The insolent deride us in our plight, save us that we may thank You, our Rock, that You have delivered us from our tormentors. Your dispersed ones look to You for support, strengthen them in their fear of You, for this is the whole purpose of man.}
\hebeng{חֻקּוֹת הָעַמִּים תֹּהוּ. חֲשׁוּקֶיךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ יִנָּהוּ. כִּי־חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם הוּא: טִירָתְךָ הֻשְֹמָה לְעִיִּים. טַיְּבָהּ בְּחוֹמוֹת בְּנוּיִים. כִּי־טוֹב חַסְדְּךָ מֵחַיִּים:\par }{The laws of the heathen peoples are vanity, but Your desired ones follow You longingly for You are gracious and merciful. Your Temple was turned into ruins, favor her with rebuilt walls, for Your kindness \textit{In returning Your \textit{Shechinah} to dwell among us.} is better than life.}
\hebeng{יָגַעְתִּי וְאָשִֹיחָה בְּמַעֲנִי. יֵבוֹשׁ וְיִכָּלֵם מְעַנִּי. כִּי־יַעֲשֶֹה יְהֹוָה דִּין עָנִי: כָּבְדוּ שִֹפְתֵי קָמַי. כָּל־הַיּוֹם מַזְעִימַי. כִּי־כָלוּ בְעָשָׁן יָמַי:\par }{I am weary and in my affliction I pray: “May my oppressor be shamed and disgraced,” for Adonoy will do justice for the afflicted. The speech of my enemies lie heavy on me, they provoke me all the day, and thus my days are consumed in smoke.}
\hebeng{לָהֶם יָשִׁיב כְּפָעֳלָם. לְעַמּוֹ יְלַמֵּד לְהוֹעִילָם. כִּי־לֹא יִזְנַח לְעוֹלָם: מְרַחֲמוֹ יִתֵּן מַאֲוָיוֹ. מִמֶּנּוּ יָסִיר דָּפְיוֹ. כִּי מַה־טּוּבוֹ וּמַה יָּפְיוֹ:\par }{May He pay them according to their deeds, \textit{Israel’s.} and thus teach His people a beneficial lesson, that He will not cast us off forever. May his Merciful One grant his desire, and remove his disgrace from him, for how good and how beautiful was he. \textit{When he {[Israel]} lived on its own land.}}
\hebeng{נְשַׁמּוֹת הוּשָׁתוּ עָרַי. וְנָכְרִים בָּאוּ שְׁעָרַי. כִּי־נָשָֹאתִי חֶרְפַּת נְעוּרָי: שֹוֹשֹ אָשִֹישֹ עָלֶיךָ. שִֹיחַ לַעֲנוֹת גְּאוּלֶיךָ. כִּי־שִֹמַּחְתַּנִי יְהֹוָה בְּפָעֳלֶךָ:\par }{My cities have become ruins, strangers have entered my gates, because I bore the disgrace \textit{The sins.} of my youth. “I will yet greatly rejoice in you,” \textit{Isaiah 61:10.} when You will say this to Your redeemed, \textit{Israel.} {[they will say:]} “For You have given me joy, Adonoy, with Your deeds.”}
\hebeng{עִזּוּז נוֹרָא וְאָיוֹם. עַתָּה הַמְצִיאֵנוּ פִדְיוֹם. כִּי־עָלֶיךָ הֹרַגְנוּ כָּל־הַיּוֹם: פַּנֵּה דֶּרֶךְ עָקֹב. פְּאֵר הִלּוּלָךְ לִנְקֹב. כִּי־גָאַל יְהֹוָה אֶת יַעֲקֹב:\par }{Mighty One! Awesome One! Revered One! cause our redemption now, because for Your sake, we are continually slain. Clear the crooked way {[of impediments]} that we may proclaim Your glorious praise— that Adonoy has redeemed Jacob.}
\hebeng{צָרִים לְכַלּוֹת בְּחֶרֶץ. צְפֵה מִשְּׁמֵי עֶרֶץ. כִּי־צֵל יָמֵינוּ עֲלֵי אָרֶץ: קָרֵב קֵץ עִדָּנַי. קוֹל לְהַשְׁמִיעַ לְעוֹיְנַי. כִּי־קָרוֹב יוֹם יְהֹוָה:\par }{May our enemies perish by excisement, look down on us from the mighty heavens, for our days on earth are a shadow. Bring near the time of my redemption, let my enemies hear {[Your]} voice {[proclaim]}: “That the day of Adonoy is near.” \textit{Joel 1:15.}}
\hebeng{רָם זְרֹעֲךָ תַּרְאֶה. רַעֲיָתְךָ פָּנִים הִתְרָאֶה. כִּי־רָם יְהֹוָה וְשָׁפָל יִרְאֶה: שְׁמַע קוֹל תַּחֲנוּנַי. שַׁוְעָתִי תַּעֲלֶה לִמְעוֹנַי. כִּי שׁוֹמֵעַ אֶל אֶבְיוֹנִים יְהֹוָה:\par }{Exalted One, show Your arm, to Your beloved, \textit{Israel.} show a pleasant countenance, for though Adonoy is exalted, He still regards the lowly. \textit{psalms 138:6.} Hear the voice of my supplication, let my prayer ascend to Your dwelling, for Adonoy hears the cry of the needy.}
\hebeng{תַּחַן כְּתוֹדָה תִּרְצֶה. תֹּאמַר לְעַמְּךָ אֶתְרַצֶּה. כִּי־תּוֹרָה מֵאִתִּי תֵצֵא: שֶׁקֶל מֹאזְנַיִם יִכְבָּשׁ. עֹז יַעֲטֶה וְיִלְבָּשׁ. כִּי־הוּא יַכְאִיב וְיֶחְבָּשׁ:\par }{Favor our prayer as a thanksgiving offering, say to Your people, “I will show you favor,” for the Torah shall go forth from Me. He will incline the scale {[in our favor]}, He will garb and wrap Himself in strength, for He causes pain and brings healing.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{תָּשׁוּב תְּרַחֲמֵנוּ תִּכְבֹּשׁ עֲוֺנֹתֵינוּ וְתַשְׁלִיךְ בִּמְצֻלוֹת יָם כָּל־חַטֹּאתֵינוּ׃ שׁוּב מֵחֲרוֹן אַפֶּךָ וְהִנָּחֵם עַל־הָרָעָה לְעַמֶּךָ׃ שׁוּבָה יְהוָה אֶת־שְׁבִיתֵנוּ כַּאֲפִיקִים בַּנֶּגֶב׃ הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהוָה אֵלֶיךָ וְנָשׁוּבָה חַדֵּשׁ יָמֵינוּ כְּקֶדֶם׃\par }{Again, show us compassion, suppress our iniquities, and cast into the depths of the sea all our sins. Turn away fierce anger and let Your mind be changed concerning the evil intended for Your people. Adonoy, bring back our exiles like springs in the desert. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return; renew our days as of old.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{נא. {\small מיוסד על פי תשר״ק. חתום שלמה הבבלי.} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rav Shlomo Habavli.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{תָּשׁוּב תְּרַחֲמֵנוּ} שׁוּב שְׁבִיתֵנוּ כִּנְאֻמֶּךָ. שׁוּב כְּקֶדֶם חַדֵּשׁ חִבַּת לְאֻמֶּךָ. רַחֵק רֹגֶז וְקָרֵב שֹׁךְ זַעְמֶךָ. שׁוּב מֵחֲרוֹן אַפֶּךָ וְהִנָּחֵם עַל־הָרָעָה לְעַמֶּךָ:\par }{Again be compassionate with us, bring back our exiles as You promised, renew again as of old Your love for Your people. Remove anger and quickly quiet Your vexation. Turn from Your fierce anger and let Your mind be changed concerning the evil intended for Your people.}
\hebeng{קַבֵּץ וּבַקֵּשׁ אֹבְדוֹת וְחַזֵּק נַחֲלָתֶךָ. צֹאן הַהֲרֵגָה וְהַגְּזוּזָה בִּדְחִילָתֶךָ. פֶּשַׁע אִם רַב בִּבְנֵי מְחִילָתֶךָ. שׁוּב לְמַעַן עֲבָדֶיךָ שִׁבְטֵי נַחֲלָתֶךָ:\par }{Gather and seek the lost ones, \textit{Israel.} and strengthen Your inheritance— \textit{Israel.} {[Your]} sheep that are slaughtered and shorn for fearing You. If the transgressions are too numerous among those who crave Your forgiveness, turn {[from Your anger]} for the sake of Your servants, the tribes of Your heritage.}
\hebeng{עֲווֹן אֲבוֹתֵינוּ הִטְעִנָנוּ. וּבֹסֶר הִטְעִימָנוּ. סַף רַעַל הִשְׁקָנוּ הִלְעִנָנוּ וְהִזְעִימָנוּ. נָא כְּאָז בְּשֶׁכֶן יַחַד הִנְעִימָנוּ. שׁוּבֵנוּ אֱלֹהַי יִשְׁעֵנוּ וְהָפֵר כַּעַסְךָ עִמָּנוּ:\par }{The iniquity of our fathers has burdened us {[with exile]} and we have to taste the sour grapes; \textit{See Jeremiah 31:29. I.e. the punishment of their sins.} we were made to drink the cup of poison, bitterness and wrath. As in the days when You dwelt among us, and made our lives sweet, return to us, O God of our deliverance, and annul Your anger toward us.}
\hebeng{מָאוֹס לֹא מָאַסְתָּ חוֹסֶיךָ מְעִידֶיךָ. לוֹקִים כְּסוֹרֵחַ וּלְהִתְמָרֵחַ סִבְרָם עָדֶיךָ. כַּעַס לְרַצּוֹת בְּמִדַּת ישֶׁר מַעֲבָדֶיךָ. שׁוּבָה יְהֹוָה עַד־מָתָי וְהִנָּחֵם עַל־עֲבָדֶיךָ:\par }{You have not totally rejected those who take refuge in You and testify to Your Oneness; they have been punished for their sins, and look to You to be healed. Appease Your anger in accordance with righteous practice. Turn {[from Your anger]} Adonoy, how long? and change Your mind about Your servants.}
\hebeng{יוֹם יוֹם נְצַפֶּה גִּלּוּי סוֹדֶךָ. טָמוּם וְעָמוּם וּבָלָה בְּשַֹר חֲסִידֶיךָ. חֶרְפָּה שָׁבְרָה לִבֵּנוּ מְקַוִּים חֲסָדֶיךָ. שׁוּבָה יְהֹוָה חַלְּצָה נַפְשֵׁנוּ וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן חַסְדֶּךָ:\par }{Daily we yearn for the revelation of Your secret \textit{The coming of Moshiach.} which is sealed and hidden, {[while]} Your pious ones waste away {[in exile]}; humiliation breaks our hearts as we wait for Your graciousness. Return Adonoy, free our souls, deliver us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.}
\hebeng{זֻנַּחְנוּ וְנֶחְשַׁבְנוּ עִם יוֹרְדֵי רֶגֶב. וַיְהִי לְאֵבֶל כִּנּוֹר וְשִׁיר וְעֻגָּב. הַקּוֹדְרִים בְּרִנָה וְתוֹדָה הִתְהַלֵּךְ בְּשֶֹגֶב. שׁוּבָה יְהֹוָה אֶת‏־שְׁבִיתֵנוּ כַּאֲפִיקִים בַּנֶּגֶב:\par }{We are forsaken and counted with them that go down into the grave, into mourning has been turned {[our]} harp, and song, and flute; those who mourn with tears, will walk proudly with thanksgiving. Adonoy! Bring back our exiles like springs in the desert.}
\hebeng{דִּמְעָה לֶחֶם חוֹסֶיךָ צוּרִי אֵל. גּוֹאֵל אַיֵּה בְּחֶרֶף צָרֵי אֵל. בְּחָזוֹן אָז כְּדִבַּרְתָּ לְיִשְׁרֵי אֵל. שׁוּבָה יְהֹוָה רִבְבוֹת אַלְפֵי יִשְֹרָאֵל:\par }{Tears are the food of those who trust in You, O my Rock {[Who is]} Almighty; “Where is the Redeemer?” the Almighty’s adversaries ask scornfully. As You appeared then in a vision, as You spoke to the righteous {[prophets]}— return {[now]} Adonoy to the thousand myriads of Israel.}
\hebeng{שִׁמְעָה יְהֹוָה הַטֵּה אָזְנְךָ וְהַקְשִׁיבָה. לִמְחַלֵּי סְלַח נָא סָלַחְתִּי הָשִׁיבָה. מְשׁוּבוֹתֵינוּ רַבּוּ וּפָתַחְתָּ יִשְֹרָאֵל שׁוּבָה. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{Hear Adonoy, incline Your ear and listen to those who plead, “Please forgive,” reply, “I have forgiven.” Even though our sins are numerous, You open the door saying. “Return O Israel.” Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}, and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent. “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{שׁוּבָה יְהֹוָה חַלְּצָה נַפְשֵׁנוּ וְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנוּ לְמַֽעַן חַסְדֶּֽךָ: שׁוּבוּ שׁוּבוּ אָמַרְתָּ לָנוּ, וְעַל הַתְּשׁוּבָה מֵרֹאשׁ הִבְטַחְתָּנוּ: זִבְחֵי אֱלֹהִים רוּחַ נִשְׁבָּרָה לֵב־נִשְׁבָּר וְנִדְכֶּה אֱלֹהִים לֹא תִבְזֶה׃ תָּבוֹא לְפָנֶיךָ אֶנְקַת אָסִיר כְּגֹדֶל זְרוֹעֲךָ הוֹתֵר בְּנֵי תְמוּתָה׃ תִּתֵּן אֱמֶת לְיַעֲקֹב חֶֽסֶד לְאַבְרָהָם אשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּֽעְתָּ לַאֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ מִימֵי קֶֽדֶם:\par }{Return Adonoy, free our souls, and deliver us for the sake of Your kindliness. Return, return, You have said to us, regarding repentance, from the very beginning of creation You promised to accept it. The correct offering to God is a broken spirit, a broken and humbled heart, God will not despise. Let come before You the groaning of the prisoner {[of sin]}, according to the greatness of Your power set free those condemned to die. Grant truth to Jacob, kindliness to Abraham, as You have sworn to our fathers from the days of old.}
\hebeng{\textbf{כְּרַחֵם אָב} עַל בָּנִים כֵּן תְּרַחֵם יְהֹוָה עָלֵֽינוּ: לַיהֹוָה הַיְשׁוּעָה, עַל עַמְּךָ בִרְכָתֶֽךָ סֶּֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּֽנוּ מִשְׂגָּב לָֽנוּ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶֽלָה: יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם בֹּֽטֵֽחַ בָּךְ: יְהֹוָה הוֹשִֽׁיעָה, הַמֶּֽלֶךְ יַעֲנֵֽנוּ בְיוֹם קָרְאֵנוּ:\par }{As a father has compassion on his children so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy. Deliverance is Adonoy’s; upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts is with us, a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah! Adonoy of Hosts! fortunate is the man who trusts in You. Adonoy, deliver us; the King will answer us on the day we call.}
\hebeng{\textbf{סְלַח נָא} לַעֲו‍ֹן הָעָם הַזֶּה, כְּגֹֽדֶל חַסְדֶּֽךָ. וְכַאֲשֶׁר נָשָֽׂאתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה. מִמִּצְרַֽיִם וְעַד הֵֽנָּה. וְשָׁם נֶאֱמַר:\par }{“Please pardon the sins of this nation in accordance with the greatness of Your lovingkindness; and as You forgave this people from when it left Egypt until now.” And there it is said:}
\hebeng{\textbf{וַיֹּאמֶר יְהֹוָה סָלַֽחְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ:} \par }{“And Adonoy said, I have pardoned {[them]} as you have asked.”}
\hebeng{הַטֵּה אֱלֹהַי אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח עֵינֶֽיךָ וּרְאֵה שֹׁמְמֹתֵֽינוּ, וְהָעִיר אֲשֶׁר נִקְרָא שִׁמְךָ עָלֶֽיהָ כִּי לֹא עַל צִדְקֹתֵֽינוּ, אֲנַֽחְנוּ מַפִּילִים תַּחֲנוּנֵֽינוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ, כִּי עַל רַחֲמֶֽיךָ הָרַבִּים: אֲדֹנָי שְׁמָֽעָה, אֲדֹנָי סְלָֽחָה, אֲדֹנָי הַקְשִֽׁיבָה וַעֲשֵׂה, אַל תְּאַחַר. לְמַעַנְךָ אֱלֹהַי, כִּי שִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא עַל עִירְךָ וְעַל עַמֶּֽךָ:\par }{Incline Your ear, my God, and hear, open Your eyes and behold our desolate places, and the city which is called by Your Name; for it is not on account of our righteousness that we let fall our supplication before You, but because of Your great mercy. My Master, hear! My Master, pardon! My Master, listen and take action, do not delay! For Your sake, my God, because Your Name is proclaimed over Your city and over Your people.}
\hebeng{נב. {\small עקדה. חיבר ר׳ אפרים ב״ר יצחק מרגנשבורג} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rav Ephraim ben Isaac of Regensburg. It is entitled the Akeidah, the Binding and retells the episode of the binding of Isaac.}} }
\hebeng{אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ\par }{Our God and God of our fathers!}
\hebeng{\textbf{אִם אָפֵס רֹבַע הַקֵּן.} אֹהֶל שִׁכֵּן אִם־רִקֵּן. אַל־נֹאבְדָה עַל־כֵּן. יֶשׁ לָנוּ אָב זָקֵן:\par }{Though the pigeon offerings have ceased, \textit{The literal translation of the word \textup{רֶבַע} is a quarter. In the time of the Temple a poor man was permitted to bring doves or young pigeons which were worth a quarter of a \textit{dinar} for his offerings.} though the tent of His dwelling is now empty, we need not lose hope for we have the merit of our old father. \textit{Abraham.}}
\hebeng{פָּנִים לוֹ תַכִּיר. וְצִדְקוֹ לְפָנֶיךָ נַזְכִּיר. צִוִּיתוֹ, קַח־נָא אֶת־בִּנְךָ יַקִּיר. וְנִמְצָה דָמוֹ עַל־קִיר:\par }{Recognize his presence when we mention his righteousness before You; You commanded him, “Take your beloved son, and let his blood be wrung out at the side {[of the Altar]}.”}
\hebeng{רָץ אֶל הַנַּעַר וְהִקְדִּישׁוֹ. וְנַפְשׁוֹ קְשׁוּרָה בְנַפְשׁוֹ. עִטְּרוֹ בָּעֵצִים וְאִשּׁוֹ. וְנֵזֶר־אֱלֹהָיו עַל־רֹאשׁוֹ:\par }{He ran to the lad and consecrated him, though his soul was bound up in his soul; he put the wood and fire around him, and the crown of his God was on his head. \textit{Abraham was compared to the Kohain Gadol who wore the Crown of God upon his forehead.}}
\hebeng{יָחִיד רַךְ הוּקַל כַּצְּבִי. עָנָה וְאָמַר אָבִי. הִנֵּה הָאֵשׁ וְהָעֵצִים נָבִיא. וּתְשׁוּרָה אֵין לְהָבִיא:\par }{The only son, tender and light as a deer, answered and said to his father, “Behold we are bringing the fire and wood, but there is no offering to bring.”}
\hebeng{מִלִּין הֱשִׁיבוֹ מִלְּהַבְהִילוֹ. עָנָה אָבִיו וְאָמַר־לוֹ. אֱלֹהִים יִרְאֶה־לּוֹ. וְיוֹדַע יְהֹוָה אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ:\par }{He answered him with words that would not terrify him; his father said to him, “God Himself will show {[the lamb]}, and Adonoy will let us know that which is His {[sacrifice]}.”}
\hebeng{בְּמִצְוֹתֶיךָ שְׁנֵיהֶם נִזְהָרִים. וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לֹא מְהַרְהֲרִים. חָשׁוּ מְאֹד נִמְהָרִים. עַל אַחַד הֶהָרִים:\par }{Both heeded Your commandment and did not question You{[r word]}; without hesitation, they hurried quickly to one of the mountains.}
\hebeng{רָאוּ אֵשׁ תְּלוּלָה. מִהֲרוּ עֲצֵי עוֹלָה. יַחַד בְּאַהֲבָה כְלוּלָה. יִשְּׁרוּ בָּעֲרָבָה מְסִלָּה:\par }{When they saw a blazing pillar of fire, they quickly brought the wood for the burnt-offering; together, linked closely in love, they walked straight through the wilderness as though it was a plain.}
\hebeng{רָאָה יָחִיד כִּי הוּא הַשֶּׂה. נָאַם לְהוֹרוֹ הַמְּנֻסֶּה. אֹתִי כְּכֶבֶשֹ תַּעֲשֶֹה. לֹא־תַחְמֹל וְלֹא־תְכַסֶּה:\par }{When the only son perceived that he was to be the lamb, he said to his father, the tested one \textit{God had tested Abraham with nine tests and this was the tenth.} “Do with me as you would a lamb, have no pity and do not spare me.}
\hebeng{בִּי חָפֵץ וְנִכְסֹף. לְבָבִי־לוֹ אֶחְשֹף. הַאִם תִּמְנָעֵנִי סוֹף. רוּחִי וְנִשְׁמָתִי אֵלָיו יֶאֱסֹף:\par }{He {[God]} has delight in me and desires me, to Him I will bare my heart; even should you refuse to sacrifice me, in the end my spirit and my soul will be gathered unto Him.}
\hebeng{יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו עָקַד. וְחַרְבּוֹ עָלָיו פָּקַד. לְשֹוּמוֹ עַל־עֵצִים שָׁקַד. וְהָאֵשׁ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּחַ תּוּקַד:\par }{He {[Abraham]} bowed his hands and feet, and held his sword over him; he laid him carefully on the wood as the fire blazed on the altar.}
\hebeng{צַוָּאר פָּשַׁט מֵאֵלָיו. וְאָבִיו נִגַּשׁ אֵלָיו. לְשָׁחֲטוֹ לְשֵׁם בְּעָלָיו. וְהִנֵּה יְהֹוָה נִצָּב עָלָיו:\par }{He stretched forth his neck willingly, and his father came close to slaughter him in the Name of his Master and behold, Adonoy stood over him.}
\hebeng{חָקַר אֶת־אֲשֶׁר נַעֲשָֹה. הָאָב עַל־בְּנוֹ לֹא חָסָה. לִבּוֹ אֶל־כַּפָּיו נָשָֹא. וַיַּרְא אֱלֹהִים אֶת כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־עָשָֹה:\par }{God observed what was being done, how the father had not spared his son, his heart and his hands were lifted {[as one]}, \textit{To do God’s will.} and God saw all that was done.}
\hebeng{קָרָא לְמֵרֶחֶם מִשְׁחָר. תְּמוּר בִּנְךָ תִּבְחָר. הִנֵּה אַיִל אַחַר. וַעֲשֵֹה וְאַל־תְּאַחַר:\par }{God called to Abraham who was sanctified from the womb, \textit{See Rashi, Psalms 110:3.} choose an exchange for your son, behold there is another ram, offer it without delay.}
\hebeng{חֲלִיפֵי אַזְכָּרָתוֹ. תִּכֹּן הַקְטָרָתוֹ. וְתַעֲלֶה תְּמוּרָתוֹ. וְהָיָה הוּא וּתְמוּרָתוֹ:\par }{The exchanged {[ram]} will be his offering, its burning will be proper and its smoke will ascend; and it will be {[as if]} he and his exchange {[are offered before Me]}.}
\hebeng{זִכָּרוֹן לְפָנֶיךָ בַּשַּׁחַק. לָעַד בְּסֵפֶר יוּחַק. בְּרִית־עוֹלָם לֹא־נִמְחַק. אֶת־אַבְרָהָם וְאֶת יִצְחָק:\par }{May the memory be before You in heaven, engraved forever in {[Your]} book, an everlasting covenant, never to be erased, with Abraham and Isaac.}
\hebeng{קוֹרְאֶיךָ בָּאִים לִקּוֹד. בְּצֶדֶק עֲקֵדָה תִשְׁקֹד. צֹאנְךָ בְּרַחֲמִים תִּפְקֹד. פְּנֵי הַצֹּאן אֶל־עָקֹד:\par }{Your worshippers have come to bow to You; regard the righteousness of that binding and remember Your flock with compassion, {[for]} the faces of Your flock look to the merit of the binding. \textit{Israel hopes that it will be redeemed in the merit of the \textit{Akeidah} {[binding]}.}}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}; and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent.” “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{נג. {\small מיוסד על פי א״ב. חתום בנימין בר זרח.} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Benjamin ben Zorach.}} }
\hebeng{הוֹרֵיתָ דֶּרֶךְ תְּשׁוּבָה, לְבַת הַשּׁוֹבֵבָה. בֵּין כֶּסֶא לֶעָשֹוֹר, עָדֶיךָ לָשׁוּבָה. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{You taught the way of repentance to the rebellious daughter {[Israel]}; between Rosh Hashana and Yom Kippur we are to return unto You {[in repentance]}. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{אָז מֵאָז מִקֶּדֶם, הִקְדַּמְתָּ תְּשׁוּבָה. בְּטֶרֶם הִמְתַּחְתָּ עֶרֶץ וִיסוֹדֵי רְגוּבָה. גַּם־לְכָל־הַשָּׁבִים, צֳּרִי וּמַרְפֵּא חֲשׁוּבָה. דּוֹפְקֵי דְלָתֶיךָ רֵיקָם מִלְּהָשִׁיבָה. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{Long ago, from of old, You prepared the way for repentance, before You spread out the mighty heavens, and established the earth; thus, for all who return, repentance is a balm and a remedy. Those who knock at Your door, do not send them away empty-handed. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{הֵן רֹאשׁ עַפְרוֹת תֵּבֵל, אֲשֶׁר רִאשׁוֹן נוֹצָר. וְנִסִּיתוֹ בְּמִצְוָה קַלָּה, וְאוֹתָהּ לֹא־נָצָר. זָעַמְתָּ וְאָנַפְתָּ עָלָיו, שְׁנוֹתָיו לְקַצֵּר. חָזַר־בִּתְשׁוּבָה וְכָאִישׁוֹן הוּנְצָר. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{Behold, the first to be created from dust, Adam, the first to be formed, You tried him with a light commandment, \textit{Not to eat from the tree of knowledge.} which he did not keep. You were indignant and angry with him, {[and decreed]} to shorten his years; but when he repented, You preserved him like the apple of Your eye. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{טָעָה גִזְעוֹ דְּמֵי־אָחִיו בְּשָׁפְכוֹ. יִסַּרְתּוֹ בְּנָע וָנָד, לֶכֶת כֹּה וָכֹה. כָּעֵת שָׁב־אֵלֶיךָ, וְעָזַב רֹעַ דַּרְכּוֹ. לְשִׁבְעָתַיִם הֶאֱרַכְתּוֹ, כָּל־מוֹצְאוֹ בְּלִי־לְהַכּוֹ. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{When his offspring {[Cain]} went astray by shedding his brother’s blood, You sentenced him to be a wanderer, to go from place to place; but when he returned to You and left his evil ways, You prolonged his life to seven generations, anyone who found him was forbidden to slay him. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{מְחַלֵּל יְצוּעֵי יוֹלְדוֹ, אֲשֶׁר־פַּחַז כַּמַּיִם. נָטָיוּ רַגְלָיו כִּמְעַט, לוּלֵי שָׁפַךְ לֵב כַּמַּיִם. סָרַח גּוּר־אַרְיֵה, בִּקְדֵשָׁה הִיא בָעֵינָיִם. עֲוֹנוֹ הוֹדָה, וְהִכְרַעְתּוֹ לְצֶדֶק בְּכַף־מֹאזְנַיִם. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{He {[Reuben]} who profaned his father’s bed, was unstable as water, his feet had almost slipped \textit{He was almost condemned to Gehinom for his sin.} had he not poured out his heart as water. \textit{Before You in repentance.} The young lion {[Judah]} sinned with Tamar at Enaim, \textit{See Genesis 38:15–23.} when he confessed his sin, You inclined the scale to justify him. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{פָּרַץ גִּדְרוֹת עוֹלָם, בֶּן־עָמְרִי בְּרֶשַׁע. צַלְמֵי־אֲשֵׁרִים חָשַׁק, וְהוֹסִיף־עַל חַטָּאתוֹ פָּשַׁע. קָרַעְתָּ גְּזַר דִּינוֹ בְּשׁוּבוֹ מִלִּפְשַׁע. רֻחַם כְּמוֹדֶה וְעוֹזֵב, וּבְךָ נוֹשַׁע. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{He broke the barriers of the world, did {[Achav]} son of Omri, with his wickedness, he desired to worship the Asherim idols, and added transgression upon sin. \textit{By causing others to do likewise.} You tore up his sentence when he repented of his transgressions; You had mercy on him as he confessed and forsook {[his evil way]}, and in You he found deliverance. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{שָׁנְנוּ לְשׁוֹנָם כְּחֵץ, אַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַגְּדוֹלָה. שִׁגְיוֹנָם וּזְדוֹנָם רָבּוּ עַד־לְמַעְלָה. תִּתְּךָ חֲזוֹן הֲפִיכָתָם, אֲחָזוּם רֶתֶת וְחַלְחָלָה. תְּשׁוּבָה עָשֹוּ כְּהֹגֶן, וְלִפְנֵי כִּסֵּא־כְבוֹדְךָ נִתְקַבְּלָה. הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{Tongues as sharp as arrows had the people of {[Ninveh]} the great city, their errors and willful sins were numerous, without count; when You sent the vision of their destruction \textit{Through the prophet Jonah.} they were seized with trembling and terror; they repented properly, and it was accepted before Your glorious throne. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{בּוֹחֵן כְלָיוֹת וָלֵב, נֶאֶזָר בִּגְבוּרָה. יַדְּעֵנוּ מַדַּע לֶכֶת בְּאֹרַח יְשָׁרָה. מְשׁוּבוֹתֵינוּ אִם־רָבּוּ בְּפֶשַׁע וּסְרָרָה. נָא לְמַעַנְךָ הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ, עֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה כַּשׁוּרָה, הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ יְהֹוָה אֵלֶיךָ, וְנָשׁוּבָה:\par }{You Who searches the innermost heart, and Who is girded with might, teach us that we may know to walk the straight path; if our rebelliousness is great with transgression and crookedness, for Your sake, please, cause us to return, that we should repent in the proper way. Cause us to return to You, Adonoy, and we shall return.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ.} יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רַחֲמִים. מִתְנַהֵג בַּחֲסִידוּת. מוֹחֵל עֲו‍ֹנוֹת עַמּוֹ. מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. מַרְבֶּה מְחִילָה לְחַטָּאִים וּסְלִיחָה לְפוֹשְׁעִים. עוֹשֶׂה צְדָקוֹת עִם כָּל בָּשָׂר וָרֽוּחַ. לֹא כְרָעָתָם תִּגְמוֹל: אֵל הוֹרֵיתָ לָנוּ לוֹמַר שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. וּזְכָר לָֽנוּ הַיּוֹם בְּרִית שְׁלשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. כְּמוֹ שֶׁהוֹדַֽעְתָּ לֶעָנָו מִקֶּֽדֶם. כְּמוֹ שֶׁכָּתוּב וַיֵּרֶד יְהֹוָה בֶּֽעָנָן וַיִּתְיַצֵּב עִמּוֹ שָׁם וַיִּקְרָא בְשֵׁם יְהֹוָה:\par }{Almighty! King! Who sits on the throne of mercy, governs with kindness forgives the iniquities of His people. He removes their sins one by one, increasing forgiveness to sinners, and pardon to transgressors. Acting righteously with all who are of flesh and spirit; not according to their wickedness does He repay them. Almighty! You instructed us to recite the thirteen Divine attributes; remember unto us this day the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes, as You made them known to the humble Moses of old, as it is written, “And Adonoy descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the Name, Adonoy.}
\hebeng{{\small קהל וחזן:} \par }{{\small \textit{Congregation and Chazzan:}} }
\hebeng{וַיַּֽעֲבֹר יְהֹוָה עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא:\par }{And Adonoy passed before him {[Moses]}; and proclaimed:}
\hebeng{יְהֹוָה יְהֹוָה אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן אֶֽרֶךְ אַפַּֽיִם וְרַב חֶֽסֶד וֶֽאֱמֶת: נֹצֵר חֶֽסֶד לָאֲלָפִים נֹשֵׂא עָו‍ֹן וָפֶֽשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה וְנַקֵּה: וְסָלַחְתָּ לַעֲו‍ֹנֵֽנוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵֽנוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ:\par }{Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, Merciful, Gracious, Slow to Anger, and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth. Keeper of kindness for thousands of generations, Endurer of iniquity, and transgression, and sin; and Acquitter of those who repent.” “And pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your inheritance.”}
\hebeng{סְלַח לָֽנוּ אָבִֽינוּ כִּי חָטָֽאנוּ. מְחַל לָֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ כִּי פָשָֽׁעְנוּ: כִּי אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי טוֹב וְסַלָּח וְרַב חֶֽסֶד לְכָל קֹרְאֶֽיךָ:\par }{Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned, forgive us our King, for we have transgressed. “For You, my Master, are good and forgiving, and abounding in kindness to all who call upon You.”}
\hebeng{\textbf{אַל תִּזְכָּר לָנוּ} עֲו‍ֹנוֹת רִאשׁוֹנִים. מַהֵר יְקַדְּמוּנוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ כִּי דַלּוֹנוּ מְאֹד: חַטֹּאת נְעוּרֵינוּ וְפְשָׁעֵינוּ אַל תִּזְכֹּר כְּחַסְדְּךָ זְכָר לָנוּ אַתָּה לְמַעַן טוּבְךָ יְהֹוָה: זְכֹר רַחֲמֶֽיךָ יְהֹוָה וַחֲסָדֶֽיךָ כִּי מֵעוֹלָם הֵֽמָּה: זָכְרֵֽנוּ יְהֹוָה בִּרְצוֹן עַמֶּֽךָ פָּקְדֵֽנוּ בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ: זְכֹר עֲדָתְךָ קָנִֽיתָ קֶּֽדֶם גָּאַֽלְתָּ שֵֽׁבֶט נַחֲלָתֶֽךָ הַר צִיּוֹן זֶה שָׁכַנְתָּ בּוֹ: זְּכוֹר יְהֹוָה חִבַּת יְרוּשָׁלָֽםִ אַהֲבַת צִיּוֹן אַל תִּשְׁכַּח לָנֶֽצַח: זְכֹר יְהֹוָה לִבְנֵי אֱדוֹם אֵת יוֹם יְרוּשָׁלָֽםִ הָאֹמְרִים עָֽרוּ עָֽרוּ עַד הַיְסוֹד בָּהּ: אַתָּה תָקוּם תְּרַחֵם צִיּוֹן. כִּי עֵת לְחֶנְנָהּ כִּי בָא מוֹעֵד: זְכֹר לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדֶֽיךָ אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּֽעְתָּ לָהֶם בָּךְ וַתְּדַבֵּר אֲלֵהֶם אַרְבֶּה אֶת זַרְעֲכֶם כְּכוֹכְבֵי הַשָּׁמָֽיִם. וְכָל הָאָֽרֶץ הַזֹּאת אֲשֶׁר אָמַֽרְתִּי אֶתֵּן לְזַרְעֲכֶם וְנָחֲלוּ לְעוֹלָם: זְכֹר לַעֲבָדֶֽיךָ לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב. אַל תֵּֽפֶן אֶל קְשִׁי הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאֶל רִשְׁעוֹ וְאֶל חַטָּאתוֹ:\par }{Remember not the sins of our ancestors; let Your compassion come swiftly toward us, for we have been brought very low. The sins of our youth and our transgressions, remember not; with Your kindliness remember us for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy. Remember Your mercies, Adonoy, and kindlinesses for they are from the beginning of the world. Remember us Adonoy with favor for Your people recall us with Your deliverance. Remember Your congregation which You have acquired of old, You have redeemed the tribe of Your inheritance, this mountain of Zion where You have dwelled. Remember, Adonoy, the affection of Jerusalem, the love of Zion, forget not until eternity. Remember, Adonoy, to the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem, {[it was they]} who said, “Raze it, raze it to its very foundations.” You will arise and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to be gracious to her, for the appointed time has come. Remember Abraham, Isaac, Israel, Your servants, to whom You swore by Your very Self, and You said to them: “I will multiply your seed as the stars of the heavens; and all this land that I have promised, I will give to your descendants, and they will inherit it forever.” Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; do not regard the stubborness of this people, or their wickedness, or their sin.}
\hebeng{\textbf{אַל נָא} תָשֵׁת עָלֵֽינוּ חַטָּאת אֲשֶׁר נוֹאַֽלְנוּ וַאֲשֶׁר חָטָֽאנוּ:\par }{Do not, we beseech You place upon us this sin, wherein we have acted foolishly and sinned.}
\hebeng{חָטָֽאנוּ צוּרֵֽנוּ סְלַח לָֽנוּ יוֹצְרֵֽנוּ:\par }{We have sinned, our Rock; pardon us our Creator.}
\hebeng{נד. {\small לרבינו יואל ב״ר יצחק הלוי} \par }{{\small This prayer is based on the Midrash of the ten martyrs who were killed by the Romans. It was written by Rav Yoel ben Yitzchok HaLevi.} }
\hebeng{יָקְרוּ רֵעֶיךָ רַב מְחוֹלֵל. אֶדּוֹם לַיהֹוָה וְאֶתְחוֹלֵל. בְּאוֹיֵב אֲשֶׁר בְּעַמִּי מִסְתּוֹלֵל. וְעַל זֹאת יִתְפַּלֵּל: יִתְפַּלֵּל כָּל־חָסִיד וְיִלְבַּשׁ שַׂקִּים. לְפַתֵּחַ רַגְלֵי אֲסוּרֵי בְזִקִּים. וְעַתָּה הִנֵּה עֲבָדֶיךָ לוֹקִים. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַלּוֹקִין:\par }{Your “friends” \textit{“Friends,” the righteous are considered God’s “friends.”} are dear, Master, Creator I shall wait for God and hope {[for His help]} {[that You take vengeance]} from the enemy that maltreats My nation. For this shall one pray. Let every pious person pray and let him don sackcloths \textit{As a sign of suffering.} to free the legs of those who are tied in chains. As of now Your servants are still smitten. “These are flogged.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{לוֹקִין וְחוֹבְטִין בְּשׁוֹטִים יְחִידָתִי. שִׁקֻּוַי בִּבְכִי מָסָכְתִּי. מִבּוֹר תַּחְתִּיּוֹת שִׁמְךָ קָרָאתִי. אַיֵּה אֵפוֹא תִקְוָתִי: תִּקְוָתִי לְשָׁלוֹם וּמֵחֲדָרִים אֵימוֹת. וּפָנַי לֹא הִסְתַּרְתִּי מִכְּלִמּוֹת. הַצְּבִי יִשְׂרָאֵל חָלָל עַל־בָּמוֹת. אֵלּוּ הֵן הָאֲשָׁמוֹת:\par }{They smite and strike with whips {[the people known as]} My one nation. \textit{I.e. Israel.} My drink was blended with tears. From the deepest pits I called Your Name: Where {[and when will I find]} my hope? My hope was for peace. {[But within our]} homes there is fear. I did not hide from disgrace. \textit{For I was accustomed to it.} Beloved Israel is slaughtered upon the hills and mountains. “These are the sin-offerings.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{אֲשָׁמוֹת עָצְמוּ וְנַחֲלָתְךָ יְעַנּוּ. וְכַצֹּאן לַטֶּבַח נֶחְשַׁבְנוּ. וְטוּבֵינוּ נִתְפְּשׂוּ בַּעֲווֹנֵינוּ. אֲבָל אֲשֵׁמִים אֲנַחְנוּ עַל־אַחֵינוּ: אַחֵינוּ הַיְּהוּדִים הָאֻמְלָלִים. כֹּל שֻׁפַּךְ דָּמָם כִּגְלָלִים. וְנִדַּשׁ בְּשָׂרָם אֶת־הַקּוֹצִים וְהַחֲרוּלִים. אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּסְקָלִין:\par }{The sins have overpowered and they {[therefore]} torture Your inheritance. \textit{I.e. Israel is tortured by the nations.} And we are considered as sheep for slaughter. The best of us are trapped for our sins. \textit{I.e. the righteous are punished for the sins of the rest.} We are truly at fault for {[that which happens to]} our brothers. Our brothers, the unfortunate Jews, all their blood is spilled as waste, and their flesh is beaten with thorns and bramble. “These are those who are stoned.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{נִסְקָלִין לְעֵינֶיךָ עֲלָמוֹת עֲלֵי־מָוֶת. וְהֵכִין לוֹ אוֹיֵב כְּלֵי־מָוֶת. וַיֹּאמֶר אָכֵן סָר מַר־הַמָּוֶת. וְקִוִּינוּ לָאוֹר וְשָׂמָהּ לְצַלְמָוֶת: לְצַלְמָוֶת בִּמְקוֹם־חֹשֶׁךְ קוֹלָם מְצַפְצְפִים. וּמִקּוֹל הַקּוֹרֵא נָעוּ אֵבָרַי וּמִתְרוֹפְפִים. עָמְדוּ בְנִסָּיוֹן וְנִמְצְאוּ צְרוּפִים. אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּשְׂרָפִין:\par }{Your young are stoned before Your eyes on {[sanctifying Your Name \textit{“Sanctify Your name’—\textup{קִדוּשׁ הַשֵׁם}—the act of giving one’s life for God.} by]} death, and the enemy has prepared for him instruments of death, and has said: “Truly the bitterness of death has reached you.” \textit{I.e. your end has come.} We hoped for light, but, He turned it to darkness of death. In the place of deep darkness, their voice {[still]} chirps. \textit{‘In … chirps,” i.e. despite great despair we don’t cease to pray.} And from the {[great]} sound of the crier my limbs tremble and turn weak. They withstood tests and were found to be purified. “These are those who are burned.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{נִשְׂרָפִין בְּסִפְרֵיהֶן כְּרָכוּם עַל־מוֹקְדָם יַחַד. וְהִקְדִּישׁוּ אֶת־קְדוֹשׁ יַעֲקֹב הַמְיֻחָד. וַיַּעֲנוּ כָּל־הָעָם קוֹל אֶחָד. וְהוּא בְאֶחָד: בְּאֶחָד יָצְאוּ נִשְׁמָתָם רַכִּים וַעֲנֻגִּים. וּלְזֶה הַיּוֹם נַפְשׁוֹתָם עוֹרְגִים. מָסְרוּ עַצְמָם לְחָרְמִין וְלַהַרָגִין. אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנֶּהֱרָגִין:\par }{They \textit{The children who studied Torah.} were burned {[together]} with their books, they were burned together on the pyre and they sanctified the Holy of Jacob Who is the only One. The entire nation answered as one that He is One. At {[the word]} One their souls departed {[they who were]} gentle and tender, and for this day their souls thirsted. \textit{They always desired to give their lives for God.} They gave themselves up to destroyers and murderers. “These are those who die by the sword.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{נֶהֱרָגִין רָבוּ. תַּלְמִיד עִם־רָב. נְשָׁכָם נָחָשׁ שָׂרָף וְעַקְרָב. וְדָמָם עַל־צְחִיחַ סֶלַע נִתְעָרָב. וְנָפַל מִמֶּנּוּ רָב: רַב וְצָעִיר וַאֲנָשִׁים צַדִּיקִים. הַנְּעִימִים בְּחַיֵּיהֶם וּבְמוֹתָם לֹא־פוֹרְקִים. עֻלָּךְ מְקַבְּלִים מוּמָתִים תַּשְׁנוּקִים. אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנֶּחֱנָקִין:\par }{The killed have become many the student with his master. They were bitten by the snake, poisonous serpent, and scorpion and their blood mixed on the barren rock when many {[of Israel]} fell. Old and young and righteous people that are beloved to one another in their lifetime and not separated in their death; they accept Your yoke {[then]} are killed by strangulation. “These are those who are strangled.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{נֶחֱנָקִין יָצְאוּ לְפָעֳלָם וְלִמְעוֹנָתָם יִרְבָּצוּן. הָאוֹיֵב מְחָרֵף וּלְשִׁמְךָ יְנַאֲצוּן. וּמִבְּשָׂרִי לֹא יִשְׂבְּעוּן וְיִמְחָצוּן. וְגַם אֶת־הַמֵּת יֶחֱצוּן: יֶחֱצוּן נְתָחִים נְתָחִים אֲמוּלִים. וּשְׁטָחוּם עֲרֻמִּים בְּדָמִים מְגֻלָּלִים. וְיִלְעֲגוּ לָמוֹ וְאֵין מַכְלִים. אֵלּוּ הֵן הַגּוֹלִים:\par }{The strangled went for their reward and to their dwelling they come to rest. \textit{I.e. they come to their share in the World to Come.} {[Yet]}, the enemy insults and abuses Your Name. And {[from]} the wounds of]} my flesh they were not satisfied and they {[continue]} to wound us, “And also the dead do they divide.” \textit{Even after having murdered, they ruthlessly defile the body.} They slice chunks of flesh from the circumcised \textit{I.e. the nation that is circumcised—Israel.} naked, they scattered them and rolled them in {[their]} blood; and ridiculed them and there was none to embarrass them. \textit{I.e. the murderous nations.} “These are those who are exiled.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{גּוֹלִים, נִתְנַכְּלוּ לָמוֹ מְדָנַי. דְּרֹשׁ אֶל־הַמֵּתִים הַנִּקְלָה בְּעֵינַי. וְנָמוּ הוֹצֵא אֶת־הַמְקַלֵּל שַׁלַּח מֵעַל פָּנַי. מִי־יִתֵּן מוּתֵנוּ בְּיַד יְהֹוָה: יְהֹוָה בְּיָדְךָ מִמְתִים חֹמֶר וְצָבוּר. וְסִדְּרוּ מַעַרְכוֹת־אֵשׁ לְחוֹבַת צִבּוּר. וְדָמָם לְפָנֶיךָ יְהִי צָבוּר. אֵלּוּ הֵן חַטֹּאת הַצִּבּוּר:\par }{Those who are exiled, their enemies conspire against them to {[coerce them]} to consult the dead \textit{‘Consult the dead’—a pagan practice.} {[something]} which is a perversion in My eyes. {[When they saw that their efforts were fruitless]}, they said: “Remove the curser {[of idols]},” remove him from my presence.” \textit{To be put to death.} Oh! would that we died at the hands of God. \textit{Rather than at the hands of our enemies.} God, in Your hands are the dead in piles and bundles. And they {[the enemies]} arranged pyres to do evil to the throngs. Let their blood be gathered before You! \textit{I.e., avenge their blood.} “These are the public sin-offerings.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{צִבּוּר אֵשׁ שָׁלְחוּ בְיָדוֹ לְהִבָּדֵק. וְלֹא אֵחֲרוּ הַבָּנִים לְקַדֵּשׁ מִלְּדַקְדֵּק. וְהוֹצִיאָם מִלִּשְׁכַּת הַטְּלָאִים בְּלִי בֶדֶק. כִּי שָׁם יִזְבְּחוּ זִבְחֵי צֶדֶק: צֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט תַּעֲטֶה לִנְקֹם נִקְמָתִי. כִּי הִשְׁמִידוּ הַיּוֹרֵשׁ וְכִבּוּ גַּחַלְתִּי. לָמָּה כְּאֵבִי נֶצַח אֲנוּשָׁה מַכָּתִי. וְאִלּוּ לַעֲבָדִים וְלִשְׁפָחוֹת נִמְכַּרְנוּ הֶחֱרַשְׁתִּי:\par }{The congregation, \textit{Of Israel.} set themselves afire to be tested, \textit{To test their own commitment to God.} and the youngsters did not procrastinate from sanctifying {[His Name]} by questioning {[God’s motives]}. They were removed from the Chamber of Sheep \textit{‘They removed … sheep’—they offered even their young as sacrifices.} without examination, \textit{I.e. without the necessary inspection of the sacrifices; meant here to express the lack of hesitation in sanctifying His Holy Name.} for there they sacrificed righteous sacrifices. Wrap Yourself in righteousness and justice, to avenge me, for they have devastated the inheritor \textit{The righteous of Israel who inherit and pass down the ways of Israel to future generations.} and {[thus]} extinguished my ember. Why is my pain constant, my wound so serious? And were it only that we were sold to slavery I would have remained silent.}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{הֶחֱרַשְׁתִּי חָרָשׁ וְאוֹיֵב מְנָאֵץ וּמְנַבֵּל. לִנְטֹשׁ יִרְאָתְךָ וְלֶכֶת אַחֲרֵי הַהֶבֶל. וַיְּמָאֵן בְּבֶצַע וְכוֹפֶר לְקַבֵּל. כִּי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חוֹבֵל: חוֹבֵל בִּקַּע הָרִיּוֹתֶיהָ בֶּן־בִּטְנֵמוֹ. וְהִכְרַעְנָה יַלְדֵיהֶן תִּפְלַחְמוֹ. וַיֹּאמֶר אַיֵּה אֱלֹהֵימוֹ וּמִיָּדִי יוֹשִׁיעֵמוֹ. וְאִי לוֹ הָאֶחָד שֶׁיִּפּוֹל וְאֵין לַהֲקִימוֹ:\par }{I remained silent as a deaf-mute while the enemy abused and disgraced {[You]}. They ceased fearing You and followed emptiness. \textit{I.e. idol worship.} He (the enemy) refused gratuity or to accept ransom \textit{He refused to be bribed and give up his ruthless desire for murder.} for {[his goal is]} to destroy the soul. The destroyer sliced her \textit{I.e. Israel’s.} pregnant ones, to destroy his offspring and they kneeled {[expelling]} their children through the fissures. And {[they destroyer]} said: “Where is his God, that can save him from me? And woe to the one {[nation]} that falls without anyone to raise him.”}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{לַהֲקִימָהּ קוּמָה עַד־מָתַי יְנַאֲצוּנִי. וְהָיָה כָל מוֹצְאִי יַהַרְגֵנִי. לָכֵן אֲמָרֵר בִּבְכִי אַל־תָּאִיצוּ לְנַחֲמֵנִי. וְעוֹלַלְתִּי בֶּעָפָר קַרְנִי: קַרְנִי נִגְדְּעָה בְּגוּמִין אֲשֶׁר־כָּרוּ זָרִים. וּקְבָרוּם חַיִּים בְּנִקְרַת הַצּוּרִים. וַתְּכַס עֲלֵיהֶם הָאָרֶץ וּמֵתוּ בֵּין הַגְּזָרִים. אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּקְבָּרִים:\par }{{[God]} rise up to raise her. \textit{I.e. Israel.} How long will they {[continue to]} disgrace me; that whoever finds me slaughters me? Therefore, I cry with bitter tears, {[thus]}, do not rush to console me, {[for]} I have soiled my radiance with dirt. My strength was cut down by pitfalls that strangers dug, and they buried them alive in the perforation of the rocks. The earth covered them {[where]} they died amongst the murdered. “These are those that are buried.” \textit{“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the \textup{בֵּית דִין}—the Jewish court.}}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{נִקְבָּרִין הֲרוּגָה יַעֲלוּ כִּקְטֹרֶת מְתֻקָּן. לָתֵת לָנוּ מִחְיָה שְׁאֵרִית וּפֻרְקָן. וְיָגֶל אֶבֶן מִבְּאֵרוֹת בְּנֵי יַעֲקָן. יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה יוֹם נָקָם: נָקָם יָשִׁיב לְצָרָיו אֱדוֹם וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל. כִּי חִלְּלוּ מְקֻדָּשִׁי וַחֲבֵרוֹ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אַל־תֶּחֱרַשׁ לְדָמָם וְאַל תִּשְׁקֹט אֵל. נְקֹם נִקְמַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:\par }{The buried and the slaughtered, may they rise {[to You]} as perfect incense to give us life, a remnant, and redemption; \textit{‘The buried … redemption’ i.e. let the merit of those who gave their life to sanctify Your Name serve to keep alive and bring redemption to those of us who are left.} and let the stone be removed from the wells of the suffering. \textit{‘And let … suffering’—a play on the story when Jacob (\textup{בני יעקן}) removed the stone from the well where he met Rachel. ‘\textup{יעקן}‘ is derived from ‘\textup{עָקָא}‘ i.e.—suffering.} Let the righteous one rejoice when he sees the day of vengeance. Let Him pay vengeance to His enemies, Edom and Ishmael, for they profaned my holy one \textit{A reference to R’ Ishmael the High Priest.} and his associate Rabbon Simon b. Gamliel. Be not silent over their {[spilt]} blood and do not rest, O God. Avenge the vengeance of the Israelites!}
\hebeng{חָטָאנוּ צוּרֵנוּ סְלַח לָנוּ יוֹצְרֵנוּ:\par }{We have sinned to You, our Rock, forgive us, our Creator.}
\hebeng{\textbf{זְכוֹר } לָֽנוּ בְּרִית אָבוֹת כַּאֲשֶׁר אָמַֽרְתָּ. וְזָכַרְתִּי אֶת בְּרִיתִי יַעֲקוֹב וְאַף אֶת בְּרִיתִי יִצְחָק וְאַף אֶת בְּרִיתִי אַבְרָהָם אֶזְכֹּר וְהָאָֽרֶץ אֶזְכֹּר:\par }{Remember to us the covenant of the Patriarchs, as You promised, “And I will remember my covenant with Jacob, and also my covenant with Isaac, and also my covenant with Abraham will I remember,” and the land I will remember.}
\hebeng{נה. {\small חתום גרשום בר יהודה (מאור הגולה)} \par }{{\small \textit{This prayer was composed by Rabbi Gershom ben Yehudah (the Light of the Exile).}} }
\hebeng{זְכֹר בְּרִית־אַבְרָהָם וַעֲקֵדַת יִצְחָק. וְהָשֵׁב שְׁבוּת אָהֳלֵי יַעֲקֹב. וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{Remember the covenant of Abraham and the binding of Isaac, and return the captives of the tents of Jacob and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{אַשְׁמָתֵנוּ כִּי רַבָּה, בֵּית מִקְדָּשֵׁנוּ לְחוֹבָה. בָּגַדְנוּ בִּיתֵרָה חִבָּה, וַתְּהִי לְהֶפֶךְ סִבָּה. וְשׁוּב בְּרַחֲמִים עַל שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{For our sins are great our Temple was taken as a debt. We betrayed Your abundant love which caused a reversal {[of that love]}. Return with compassion to the remnant of Israel and save us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{פְּעֻלַּת רִאשׁוֹנִים חֲסִידֶךָ זְכוֹר עֹז יְדִידֶיךָ. צַוֵּה יְשׁוּעַת עֲבָדֶיךָ. גַּלֵּה כָּמוּס סוֹדֶיךָ: וְהָשֵׁב שְׁבוּת אָהֳלֵי יַעֲקֹב. וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{The deeds of Your first righteous remember, {[as well as]} the strength of Your friendship. Command the redemption of Your servants. Reveal Your hidden secret. Return the captives of the tents of Jacob and save us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{קָשַׁרְנוּ בְאַחְוָה וְתוֹפֵל, וְלִמְאֹד שִׂיחֵנוּ שָׁפֵל, רָם, הֲקִימֵנוּ מִנּוֹפֶל. וְתוֹצִיא לָאוֹר מֵאֹפֶל: וְשׁוּב בְּרַחֲמִים עַל שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{We became tied as brothers to frivolity and insipidness. Our speech (quality of prayer) has greatly sunk. Exalted One! Raise us up from our low state and bring us into the light from darkness. Return with compassion to the remnant of Israel and save us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{שֶׁטֶף אֵשׁ וְלֶהָבָה, לְהַשְׁבִּית נוֹגֵשׂ וּמַדְהֵבָה. מִצַּר עֶזְרָתֵנוּ הָבָה. הָקִיצָה לְעוֹרֵר אַהֲבָה: וְהָשֵׁב שְׁבוּת אָהֳלֵי יַעֲקֹב. וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{{[Pour]} a tide of fire and flame {[upon our enemies]}, to destroy the torturer and the haughty one. From the oppressor {[to be saved]} send us Your help. Awaken! to arouse Your love {[for us]}. Return the captives of the tents of Jacob and save us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{גּוֹאֵל חָזָק לְמַעַנְךָ פְּדֵנוּ. רְאֵה כִּי אָזְלַת יָדֵנוּ. שׁוּר כִּי אָבְדוּ חֲסִידֵינוּ. וּמַפְגִּיעַ אֵין בַּעֲדֵנוּ: וְהָשֵׁב שְׁבוּת אָהֳלֵי יַעֲקֹב. וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{Mighty Redeemer, for Your sake redeem us, see how helpless we are, look, our pious men are gone, and we have none to intercede for us. Return the captives of the tents of Jacob and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{בְּרִית אָבוֹת וְאִמָּהוֹת וְהַשְּׁבָטִים, רַחֲמֶיךָ וַחֲסָדֶיךָ בִּרְבוֹת עִתִּים, יָהּ זְכוֹר לְמֻכִּים וְנִמְרָטִים. וְעָלֶיךָ כָּל הַיּוֹם נִשְׁחָטִים: וְשׁוּב בְּרַחֲמִים עַל שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{The covenant with the Patriarchs the Matriarchs and the {[twelve]} tribes, Your oft-repeated mercy and kindness— remember {[now]} O God to those who are stricken and tortured, and for Your sake {[they are ready]} to be killed all the day. Turn with compassion to the remnant of Israel, and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.}
\hebeng{דֹּרֵשׁ דָּמִים דּוֹן דִּינֵנוּ. הָשֵׁב שִׁבְעָתַיִם אֶל חֵיק מְעַנֵּינוּ. חִנָּם נִמְכַּרְנוּ וְלֹא בְכֶסֶף פְּדֵנוּ. זְקֹף בֵּית־מִקְדָּשְׁךָ הַשָּׁמֵם לְעֵינֵינוּ: וְהָשֵׁב שְׁבוּת אָהֳלֵי יַעֲקֹב. וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ לְמַעַן שְׁמֶךָ:\par }{You Who avenges {[innocent]} blood, judge our cause, repay {[punish]} sevenfold into the bosom of those who torment us; we have been sold for naught, {[therefore]} redeem us without {[ransom]} money, raise up Your ruined, Holy Temple, before our {[very]} eyes, and return the captives of the tents of Jacob and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.}
